Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! The staff was super friendly, especially with directions and advice on where to go for food and drinks, and what sites to see! The location is great, we walked everywhere! The room was comfy and clean. I will definitely stay here again on my next trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hampton.”
Reviews.Author: VMAK09
Reviews.Content: Very unique Hampton Inn in an excellent location. Close enough to walk to the Field Museum & Shedd Aquarium and then you can walk in the opposite direction to the Willis Tower. The room overall was great and on par with all the other "nicer" Hampton Inns I've stayed at. One thing to note, that even on the weekend breakfast started way earlier but did end around 10am so breakfast was available to all. No complaints minus the slowness of the elevators (to be expected in a historic building). All in all, fantastic hotel in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ozylouincanada
Reviews.Content: Big rooms, comfy beds and wonderful staff make this agreat place to stay in chicago. Great location for all the sites and the free breakfast is just fab :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hampton Majestic”
Reviews.Author: psianojr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a family vacation and had a wonderful experience. Great location - everything we wanted was pretty much within walking distance. Great hot breakfast every morning that changed daily to provide nice variety. Plus lots of fruit, pastries, etc. each day. Staff was very friendly and helpful - some more than others but overall very good. My only complaints were pretty minor - would have liked more TV channel choices (good but not great) and would have liked more sitting options in the room. One more chair would have been great. Would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay here again if we return to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but tiny elevators”
Reviews.Author: CMcK1
Reviews.Content: My family and I visit Chicago many times during the year and nearly always stay downtown. We typically stay in a Hilton family hotel (which Hampton Inn is) because of the Hilton Honors reward program. The rooms in the Hampton Majestic are on par with rooms in the Palmer House Hilton or Chicago Hilton. What you don't get at the Hampton Majestic that you get at the Palmer House or Chicago Hilton is the extravagant lobby and other common areas. BUT, the WiFi is free for everyone, not just Hilton Honors members, and you will pay extremely inflated prices for WiFi service at the Palmer House or Chicago Hilton if you aren't in the Hilton Honors program. We were in room 2009 on the 20th floor (top floor) - high ceilings, modernly decorated, and a very spacious room easily accommodating my family of 4 which includes two adult-sized teenagers :-) My only dissatisfaction was with the extremely small elevators. My family and I could barely, and I mean barely, fit in the elevator with our bags (carry-on size) - it was a cozy ride to the top... I would certainly stay again despite the tiny elevators. In case you don't know - valet parking is $42/night with in and out privileges - pricey, but normal for downtown hotels, which some charge as much as $55/night. And of course, you can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: travel4002
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great value for the price you pay. It is convenient, easy to get to and close to almost everything in the theatre district. It is quiet and cozy and in excellent condition and kept clean. The furnishings were upscale. The staff were very courteous, friendly and helpful. The hotel was quiet at night which was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and nicely decorated”
Reviews.Author: flipsyde112
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a convenient location right in the middle of downtown Chicago. It's very close to a blue line subway station. The staff is very friendly and try to help however they can in finding places nearby. The rooms themselves are some of the best decorated rooms I have seen. It is very modern, and is very fitting for downtown Chicago. The bed is very comfortable, and the rooms are surprisingly quiet. I slept very well here. In the morning, the breakfast is very good and has a variety of hot food items. Even better, it's free. It can be a little pricey, but for this area, it's definitely understandable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay At The Hampton Majestic”
Reviews.Author: Sliphorn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Majestic Theatre on our way to an Amtrak vacation. It was extremely nice. The check in was simple and there were two or three doorman to assist with everything. We zipped up to our room and found it very satisfying. They have it set up that you have to use your key to be able to go higher than the fourth floor for security. all the staff was fantastic and helpful. We ate the free breakfast and it was all you could want and in a large area so you were not sitting on top of each other. It is a boutique hotel and had been remodeled not long ago. It is very hip. Dinner was easy as we walked across the street to the Italian Village, a Chicago institution of quality and service. Check out was also no sweat and we were on our way, having to go only a few blocks to Union Station. I will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Location+facilities+great service=UNBEATABLE”
Reviews.Author: edgarvhulcer
Reviews.Content: World class Location!!! Heart of the downtown with red and blue metro lines just a couple of feet away!!! Everything is near!!! Absolutely unbeatable!!!!! We stayed here (family & friends) last weekend and enjoyed our stay very much. How can we ever possibly not recommend this hotel???? Cynthia at the front desk was SO KIND AND HELPFUL as well as all other staff we ever came across with. We were a party of 5 so we booked a room with double queen-size beds + a rollout bed and the hotel kept up with their name and status. The rollaway bed was actually a full single-size bed as nice and comfy as the queen-sized ones. Rooms are very clean (which is the top priority for me) and are VERY comfortable. They obviously see good maintenance because it didn't show any visible wear out and they absolutely don't smell at all. No cigarette or anything else. Bathrooms, carpet, bed linens and all were VERY clean. Room had 32" LCD, wired & wireless internet included as well as breakfast (and not just tea & coffee, but real breakfast with juice, sausages, fruit, eggs, yogurt, bagels, muffins, waffles... very complete. I hope to be back in the summer, since Buckingham Fountain, the Chicago river & Lake Michigan cruises are not available in winter. When looking for a hotel next time, this will be my first option for sure! If price is good, I'll book and be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice for business travel and absolutely loved it. Everyone from the concierge staff, front desk staff, breakfast and housekeeping staff were fantastic and very helpful. The hotel and room decor is stylish and comfortable. The hotel is within walking distance of many Chicago attractions. The inclusion of breaksfast and free WiFi is a real plus. It is excellent value in so many ways! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem (and a bargain) in Chicago!!”
Reviews.Author: kersaraam
Reviews.Content: We checked out so many Chicago hotels before we decided where to stay. The Hampton Majestic seemed to good to be true - but it wasn't! From the minute we arrived, we were impressed. The young lady on the reception desk on Thursday, January 26, is amazing! (*Note to management - this girl deserves a raise. She is such a great "face" for the hotel) The room was sparkling clean and SO QUIET! We'd read so often about noisy hotels in Chicago, but not the Majestic. Bed was very comfy. Breakfast was great, with lots of fresh fruit and hot entrees. The kitchen staff kept things topped up. The hotel itself is located in a great area. We walked everywhere because we enjoyed being out in the neighbourhood - where we felt totally safe. We spoke to many "street folk" and they were wonderful characters. Plenty of good restaurants everywhere. The Millennium Mile was a healthy jaunt from the hotel but choose to walk because there was so much to see. Public transit is excellent. We didn't take a car and were very happy with that choice. You don't need a car in downtown Chicago. Based on facility, price, location, amenities and staff, we'd highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cathryn S
Reviews.Content: Went to Chicago for New Years and stayed here for 3 nights. Found the hotel on tripadvisor and all the great reviews convinced me to stay here. such a great place to stay and its cheap (but doesn't feel like you are staying in a cheap hotel). First, the staff was amazing. My boyfriend and I arrived in Chicago on a Friday morning at 8am. We were exhausted from getting up so early to leave Boston. We stopped at the hotel to drop off our bags (because we assumed we wouldn't be able to check in until 3pm like their website says) and our room was ready - so we got to check in early (for no extra cost)! Continental breakfast was happening while we were checking in, so the person who checked us in - told us to feel free to grab food (so got an extra continental breakfast for free). Continental breakfasts were pretty good too. They had a yummy western omelet and home fries. Rooms are really cute and look nicer than you would expect for a hampton inn. The hotel is in a great location, especially if you want to go to the theater (literally next door). Hotel was right next to the red and blue line - so perfect for taking public transportation around the city and to the airport. Our flight home was in the evening, so they let us keep our bags at the hotel after we checked out (so we could explore the city without our luggage). Extremely helpful and nice hotel staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for city lovers”
Reviews.Author: swizzleman
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is in an amazing location, right in the heart of Chicago. When you walk out the door of this converted early 20th century office building, you are just blocks from the Art Institute of Chicago and Millienium Park, Chagall's Four Seasons mosaic in on the corner, Calder's Flamingo sculpture is on the next block, the Berghoff restaurant is two blocks away, and the "El" is around the corner to take you anywhere you want to go in Chicago. The hotel rooms are attractive and comfortable. Hampton Inn showed real pride of place by hiring a photographer to take photos of architectural details of the Majestic Theater, which shares the building, during renovations.These photos are in all the rooms and public areas, and make a nice change from the usual hotel art. There is a breakfast bar included with the stay, and free coffee and fruit available throughout the day in the lobby. The staff were always polite and helpful. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel but decent and affordable”
Reviews.Author: yojimbo7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 28-29 January while in town for the UFC on FOX. Although we checked in at around noon (which was nice of the hotel staff since we had a reservation for 3) we actually spent very little time at the hotel. First off: the hotel sign is pretty high up and the sign color almost matches the building color; this makes it hard to pick out while driving. There's a valet, which was 42 bucks for 24 hours with in/out privileges, and we took advantage of this. Millennium Garage is fairly close by but it's $29 for 24 hours and once you leave the garage you have to pay again. So take that into account when you make your decision. Staff was very friendly and accommodating; absolutely no issues there. The room itself was clean, spacious for the price, and comfortable. The bed was a bit uncomfortable for my wife but we're used to a different mattress. And she's pregnant, so it's probably a bit unfair to blame the bed too much in this case. There's free wi-fi in the hotel and breakfast was included (served until 10am); the hotel also has a fitness room but we didn't make it there so I couldn't tell you how good or bad it is. The hotel itself sits in the Theater District, which is apparently where people avoid having dinner or drinks past 9pm on a Saturday since 2 of the 3 restaurants we walked to were closed (we also noticed other restaurants with closing times of 9pm), so this is not a good place for nightlife. We did, however, walk a half a block or so to the Italian Village restaurant, which was very good (and open past 9pm). The 126 bus goes from Adams and State to Greektown (where we also went) and costs $2.25 and ~7 minutes of your time. Overall, it's a nice, well-kept hotel in a neighborhood with little nightlife; close to bus and metro stops and parking. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DanielleDurham_NC
Reviews.Content: I just finished my stay at the Hampton Inn Majestic and I wanted to suggest it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Chicago. This was a very clean hotel and a great staff. For a downtown hotel the rooms were huge and had great beds. The location was great and had plenty to do around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RoshniPatel
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago for visiting my family and friends. The hotel rooms were very clean and bed was comfortable. The front desk people were very helpful and cooperative. The breakfast was nice and food delivery services was also helpful.Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the middle of the loop”
Reviews.Author: deardiva
Reviews.Content: Don't let the outside of this hotel fool you. It's a small hotel with comfortable quiet rooms. While the view out of our windows was the rooftop of a smaller building, the room made up for it. And yes, because of the decor and the direction our room faced - the room was somewhat dark, but it was ok. Unless you're spending all day in the room, it shouldn't be an issue. The bed was super comfy and the room was clean. Staff was friendly, including the valet downstairs. It's located in the middle of the loop within walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing find!!”
Reviews.Author: kseis
Reviews.Content: I found this place through Trip Advisor, and as usual we were not disappointed. The outside is typical old school Chicago Architecture, but the inside is really trendy. Just blocks from Michigan Avenue (Art Institute, Millenium Park, Shopping). Even closer to State Street with more restaurants and shopping. You can take a 40 min train ride from the airport and it drops off about 1/4 block from the hotel. This will be the only place we stay when going to Chicago from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Krush W
Reviews.Content: First time in Chicago and was going to stay with my brother but he fell asleep and would not wake. I was not comfortable with the last minute reservation because I did not know what to expect. I am accustomed to big hotels 500+ rooms. Walking in I was still skeptical but I was greeted by Denise. She is awesome. JC the security guard was great also. I am really big on customer service and these two earned A++. I saw my room and loved it. The colors and accessories are magnificent. The bed comfy. I am staying 2 nights (sorry bro) Denise and JC helped map out my excursion. This hotel is literally in the center of everything. I am glad I found this place and decided to stay. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for all attractions”
Reviews.Author: Wagwsg222
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights there - great staff and Lovett room. Location can't be beat. Would definitely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I remembered.”
Reviews.Author: hlalwine
Reviews.Content: Each year my family travels to Chicago for a conference the week after Thanksgiving. We used to stay at the Palmer House Hilton and now stay at the Hampton Majestic because it is caddy corner to the Palmer House and a lot less expensive. The customer service at the Majestic is very good (mostly) but the quality seems to have declined since we stayed there last year. The sheets on the bed for the entire week slid off every night, seemed to catch on our clothes, so when we would roll over, the sheets would cling and were scratchy. Certainly NOT the Hampton bed I remember. We are Hilton Honors members and this bed was terrible. From the sheets to the level of comfort... it was bad. Both my husband and I had a back ache every night. The second issue we had with this hotel was the breakfast. It was lacking from the other years we stayed there. I don't know if there has been new management since last year but the breakfast was not good. It was all the frozen and thawed items that you get at other chain hotels but the Hampton usually has other items to off-set the standard items. The muffins and rolls were dried out and had no flavor. The waffle machine was broken. They did offer hot oatmeal for 2 of the days we were there but no brown sugar or raisins. I watched just about 15 guests ask the attendant if they had any of this and she looked at each one (including myself) like we were crazy for asking. They only had nuts to go with the oatmeal. Annoying. So, next year we will try a different hotel. Maybe a different chain since the Hilton chains have started letting us down.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago in Winter, No other place to go!”
Reviews.Author: Signore_Colomo
Reviews.Content: When you arrive the the Hampton Inn Majestic, the only thing that it's cold, it's the weather. With a warmth welcome from the Hapton staff, and the like-new rooms, this very well located hotel can not be beat in downtown Chicago. You are only 3 block away from Michingan Ave at the millenium park, and two block away from one of the loop's metro station, so yoou can move around Chicao freely!. Of course the relation cost-quality it's a winner!!

Reviews.Title: “Was In town for Donny & Marie Christmas Show”
Reviews.Author: DaveEB310
Reviews.Content: Usually my reviews are a bit more extensive and detailed, but I donâ€™t have much to say except that my wife and I had a very very nice stay here. Cynthia at the front desk took care of us with an upgrade for my wifeâ€™s birthday. The breakfast was actually quite good, both mornings. The hotel was in an excellent location for shopping and the show that we came into town for, and there are plenty of good restaurants nearby. The staff was friendly and courteous, and our room was cleaned thoroughly by housekeeping. We look forward to a return. Thank you Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, no fuss”
Reviews.Author: erasmus_v
Reviews.Content: A good central location a few blocks from Grant and Millennium Parks, the Art Institute, and some decent shopping. We walked to the Magnificent Mile and the river, too - but whether that's closer for everyone is relative, I suppose. As a HHonors Diamond, I was upgraded to a 21st floor room with a majestically high ceiling and a view of the Palmer House Hilton across the street. We had a large room with two queen sized beds, and a bathroom with a shower-tub. There aren't many rooms on each floor. The cleaners are efficient and do a good job. The breakfast buffet in the lobby is free (as it is at all Hamptons, I think). It does get crowded and stuff can run out - so it pays to head down early if you're able. The hotel also offer free wifi, which is always a plus. Friendly front desk staff: we were efficiently checked in on our 1am arrival, and they were helpful with tips for getting around the city, and umbrellas for the rain. The valet service was efficient and handled our car with a combination of speed and care. The parking garage is a few blocks away, so call ahead if you know you need to go. I'm told not all Hampton Inns are like this - this was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: teenagedream
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a school trip to Chicago with 8 girls, and we stayed at the Hampton Inn. It was 4 girls to a room - and we had more than ample space with two beds, however our teacher got them to bring a cot so we ended up having 3. The room's were nicely furnished with more than enough drawer and closet space for 2 people (maximum). The bathroom was great, very spacious and I had no problem with hot water or water pressure. Breakfast is complimentary in the lobby from 6-10am (I believe, not sure) - and its more than sufficient. There is a waffle maker, choice of yogurts, cereals, fruit, toast, bagels, and two hot dishes that alternate daily. Also throughout the day, hot chocolate, teas and coffees are available in the lobby -greatly appreciated considering the weather. The computer in the lobby was also GREAT as I didn't bring my laptop - everyone loves free wifi ;) Coming from the Caribbean it was nice to still have everything at our fingertips, shops (Forever 1, Charlotte Russe), restaurants and a CVS 1-2 blocks away. Also its close to public transportation - which we found very useful :) All in all I'd come back here again (with my mom this time haha) - I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very good location”
Reviews.Author: JimKal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a recent visit to Chicago. I think the staff was friendly and helpful. It is quite convenient to public transportation. It is a few blocks for the LaSalle station for rail travel but very walkable if you know where you are going (we didn't, but still walked it with our typical scenic, but unplanned, detour). The buffet breakfast is typical Hampton fare, not remarkable but included in your room cost. You can treat yourself to a better lunch or dinner. The rooms were fine but compact. Large screen LCD TVs with a number of channels available as we'll as HBO. You are quite close to subway stops so getting to the airport (both O'Hare and Midway) is pretty easy. there are a lot of restaurants in the area as well as the whole Chicago Loop scene available to you. I would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Jay F
Reviews.Content: First time in Chicago...stuck with one of our favourite Hilton chains and we were not disappointed. Very well priced. Great location. Walking distance to the theatre we were attending. Close to three transit lines and a couple stops to shopping during the day and blues clubs at night. The rooms were well decorated, laid out and quite comfortable. What we have come to expect from a Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: vthogans
Reviews.Content: excellent location convenient to everything, decent breakfast, clean, roomy, reasonable... only downside was very expensive parking

Reviews.Title: “Good value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: TomPittsburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Majestic on a business trip and was pleased from start to finish. It's only a half block from the Blue Line train from O'Hare Airport and about 1 1/2 blocks from the Orange Line train from Midway Airport. The room was standard size with two comfortable queen beds, nice LCD TV (but I hate how this TV and most hotel TVs don't remember the last channel I was watching), good heating, bathroom that's perhaps 2 feet longer than most, good water pressure in the shower, and free WiFi. USA Today was delivered daily to my door. Since the carpet was dark, it was hard to tell how clean it was, but the beds and bathroom were clean. A refrigerator would have been nice. I really liked how there were only 9 rooms on my floor - very little walking distance from the elevator to any of the rooms. The 3 people at the front desk with whom I interacted were all very personable. Two computers (only one was working when I was there), printer (nice for boarding passes), and the breakfast area were right near the front desk. Breakfasts were filling and good, including (depending on the day) scrambled eggs or egg patty, sliced Polish sausage or link sausage, fruit salad (mostly orange, pineapple, and grapefruit), muffins, danish, cereals, and oatmeal. The danishes were a little dry and the egg patties were a bit hard, but everything else was good. Orange and passion fruit juices, milk, coffee, tea, and water are the drink options. I had the OJ, which was very good, except one day, when it was too dilute. There are many restaurant options nearby and there is a theatre right next door. In summary, I liked this hotel and its location. In comparing rates, this hotel is an excellent value, especially when you consider that it includes a filling breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: yawadnapupu
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distance to everywhere and close to transit. Friendly, helpful staff with a more than sufficient breakfast! Rooms are not huge and are a bit dark, but that helps you to sleep in if you'd like. I personally found the pillows too thick for my liking (and for my neck) but my boyfriend didnt mind and it was so insignificant compared to all the good things about the place.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: uccats97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Hampton Inn for 2 nights. It is a high rise hotel and we were on the 14th floor. There are only about 10 rooms on each floor. The building is tall and narrow and has a lot of historical charm. I enjoyed seeing the old fashioned mail chute. This is clearly an older building that has been transformed into a hotel. It is clean and has been updated to Hampton standards. Our room had very high ceilings and was right next to the fire escape, which I found interesting. Being downtown, there was some noise from traffic but not enough to be disturbing. The breakfast was the same as all Hampton Inns. The staff members maintained it very well. There is no pool in this hotel which could be an issue for some but did not bother us. The location is perfect, only a few blocks from the Magnificent Mile and the Theater District. The red line has a stop a half a block away which makes getting around town extremely quick and easy. You can buy passes for the red line at the Walgreens at the end of the block. We did all of our traveling by foot or on the red line or the bus, which are accessible from the same pass. Valet parking at the hotel is mandatory and pricey! We never used our own car but the valet men were very friendly. They always offered us advice on where to go and offered to make reservations or arrange transportation for us. Overall, this was a nice place to stay. We did not spend a lot of time in the hotel because there is so much to experience in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than the wonderful Majestic!”
Reviews.Author: tuc7k
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Majestic just before/during Thanksgiving. We used Tripadvisor reviews to determine where to stay.....and everything positive that others had written were equally true for us. The staff here may be the best ever assembled. Everyone performed their jobs flawlessly! They tout their clean rooms/clean beds. For good reason. Wonderfully crisp clean sheets all 4 nights and an amazing comforter to nestle under. Sparkling bathroom every day. Clerks at the desk in the lobby were all friendly and eager to help. Check in and out fast and smooth. Lots of smiles! Great easy to follow directions for first time visitors to Chicago. Hot Breakfasts varied every morning. Each was wonderful and tasted freshly prepared. French toast sticks. Omelets. Sausage. Kielbasa. Scrambled Eggs. Bacon. Good variety of cut fresh fruit. The staff did a fantastic job keeping up with the demand on days that the breakfast crowd was big (never seemed to be out of anything but for a minute or so--even at the end of serving time at 10:00). Also, the usual variety of breads, coffee cake, waffles, cereals, yogurt, juice. Oh. A word about their coffee, available 24 hours. Wonderful! Delicious! RIch! Sorry, that was three words--but all deserved. Our hallway on the 20th floor was quiet. Only heard others twice when we were in the hall. Once our door was closed, we didn't hear anything...until the Thanksgiving Day Parade Thursday morning. We turned on the TV and watched the Macy's Parade in NYC with the volume off so we could enjoy the bands in the Chicago Parade! Perfect! Perfect first visit to Chicago. So convenient to get around using the trains which load within blocks of the hotel. And, what an amazing city to see!!!!! I booked directly through a clerk at the hotel, explaining it was our first time in Chicago and letting him know we put ourselves in his hands for a good room that had a view. We got a tremendous room with a high ceiling and the most amazing view!!!! The room rate was also a great experience--a real bargain for the theatre area. Simply put, this is a fantastic place to stay. We are looking forward to coming back to Chicago and to the Majestic Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value and location”
Reviews.Author: Mike3889
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here on a five night business trip. Everything was good...clean rooms nicely furnished...friendly staff...good hot (free) breakfasts...and perfect location. Coming from O'Hare I was able to take the CTA Blue Line train to a stop only one block from the hotel for around $2. I was attending a training class a few blocks away and every day enjoyed a nice walk to and from class. In the evening it was nice to be located in the middle of downtown Chicago and only a few blocks from Millenuium Park, Grant Park, and the Lake where I enjoyed scenic jogging trails along the lake and river. Next time I visit Chicago for a personal vacation trip I plan to stay at this same place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Cherissa C
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. I was impressed with the staff along with the great service that they provided. Room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. All staff went out of there way to make you feel comfortable and very helpful with reccomedations. I would definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: GreatWhiteNorth88
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at this hotel. Great value for the money, you dont need to spend more at another hotel. Central, close to everything including the blue and red line trains, the lake, and food/ drink options. Short cab to everywhere else. Room was clean and cozy and every person we met who worked there was very helpful and friendly. I would stay here every time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff, Nice rooms, and doesn't burn a hole in your pocket”
Reviews.Author: muthalaly
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago recently and really enjoyed my stay @ the Hampton Inn. A very good hotel at a very decent price. Very nice staff - from the bell boy to the receptionists to the manager. The rooms were pretty good as well. Even the breakfast was pretty good. I would definitely recommend Hampton Inn to anyone traveling to Chicago and will surely be staying here on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, at a better price”
Reviews.Author: MnV6375
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right by other more famous hotels, but is less expensive. So great location, clean rooms, great service for a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You For Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: 323Sandi323
Reviews.Content: Short and simple, Christine the general manager, Tina, her assistant and RENE the best valet in the entire city are picture perfect. I will spare you the saga of horrible Chicago trip, but these three people turned a nightmare into a cake walk. They will never understand the gratitude of our family. Tip RENE well please!! He is wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy except room too dark for a long stay”
Reviews.Author: r_ontheroad
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week here and we were very happy overall with one notable exception. Our room â€“ an Executive King â€“ was on the fifteenth floor facing south (the front side of the hotel) with an office building directly across the street. We had seen this view (or lack thereof) on the hotelâ€™s website but we didnâ€™t bargain for just how dark the room would be as a result. We needed to put lights on during the day regardless of weather and this became depressing over the week. A day or two stay fine, but not longer. Otherwise we were very happy with the hotelâ€™s service (helpful and friendly staff all round), free wi-fi, decent breakfast provisions (but they need a second toaster to avoid queues), quiet room (even though it was near the elevator) and a comfortable bed (even if the bottom sheet didnâ€™t stay in place very well). Really liked being downtown with Grant Park and waterfront in easy walking distance and the Architecture Foundationâ€™s great store and walking tours starting point very close by. Would recommend the hotel if you wonâ€™t be in the room during daylight hours.

Reviews.Title: “Usable but not great”
Reviews.Author: Sidthebeachbum
Reviews.Content: Maybe I had higher expectations based on all the great comments; this was a purely average hotel, at best. The room was okay but small, and made smaller by the dark orange (burnt orange) wallpaper, and the bathroom was minimalist. So it is a downtown hotel...as small as the rooms at the "W". One good but disturbing item: They market the beds as "SO CLEAN, you will want to sleep naked"...okay, I get that they wash the spreads / blankets between guests, but next time they should buy spreads that don't bunch up when washed...it ruined the whole "clean sheet" effect since it looked like the bed had bunched socks under the covers! Breakfast; skip it. The coffee was good but, except for the cereal, all else was yuck. The cold, boil-in-a-bag eggs: Think ARMY; Instead go to the Corner Baker...2 blocks east and get a decent $7.00 breakfast. So, for what I spent I could have stayed a any other Hilton property for about 50 bucks less...especially since I canceled a night and they raised my room rate $ 59. Next time I will look for different accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good value”
Reviews.Author: mbp00
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for theatre, the symphony, the art institue and the Lyric Opera. The room we had was pretty freshly decorated, clean and not shopworn. Great view to the north of the Trump Tower and Carbide building (Hard Rock Hotel). The hotel has a buffet breakfast included - nothing special, but kept very well stocked with a different main entre on each of our three mornings. Ethernet or WiFi is included too. The Hotel is two blocks from the Orange line and within one block of the Blue and Red lines too for easy access to the airports and the rest of town. Our room was on the top (21st) floor and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: letsg01
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, that's a big plus for me. Clean room, nice sized bathroom, I like the extra touches like specially folded towels, something just a little extra. My main complaint is that no matter what we did, the bottom fitted sheets would not stay on the mattress. By the time I woke up, the fitted sheet was somewhere in the middle of the bed and I was directly on the mattress, kind of grossed me out. Bothered my kids too, as they tried to fall asleep. The location was great for us, as we walked from the train station and then walked to the museums at the lakefront, or to the Willis Tower. The hotel was pretty much in the middle of all of it, and also close to other transportation such as bus stops etc. We were able to leave our luggage there after checkout until we were ready to hop back on the train that evening. A mistake on our express-checkout bill was quickly and cheerfully corrected. (We were charged for valet parking, when we did not have a car.) Decent breakfast included, got us off to a good start. Only other slightly negative thing was the "business center" only had one working computer, which was hogged the entire night by a rude guest. Overall a very pleasant stay, would return!

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay”
Reviews.Author: rwmdoc
Reviews.Content: For the price this hotel is great. Location is excellent for down town and lake. Rooms are nice size and clean and updated. All the staff are very helpful. Free breakfast and valet parking. Parking is $40.

Reviews.Title: “Reliably Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: sdt410
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times now when I have had business in Chicago. It is above the Bank of America Theater on Monroe Street, which is a good central location, accessible to everywhere in Chicago. It is quiet, the rooms are clean, and the staff is very welcoming. The breakfast is the usual -- fresh-cooked waffles, eggs with sausages and bacon, cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc. Not gourmet fare, but good enough to fill your stomach before a business meeting. To reach any of the guest floors, you have to insert your room key in a reader in the elevator, and this is not a huge hotel, so I have always felt safe there. As a woman traveling alone, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with service!”
Reviews.Author: Bgirl1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, staff friendly and helpful, breakfast was good, convenient to trains, Michigan ave, restaurants. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanie417
Reviews.Content: Hotel has it all. Great location, staff, security, full breakfast and great price. Leighann was very helpful in explaining tours, giving directions to all attractions and restaurant recommendations. They also assisted in printing out my boarding passes. Can't say enough and would definitely stay again. Thanks to Angel and Cynthia also. Entire staff were extremely friendly, which made our stay so fantastic! PS, I rarely write reviews, but this hotel was that good.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Home Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MattandMaryTucson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrific. The location is great with easy access to all CTA train lines and many bus lines. There is shopping close by and many restaurants as well. Best of all, we had a nice sized, quiet room for a very good price. And the staff was friendly and helpful !!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Longshot2316
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. From check-in being fast and efficient (thanks Leighann) down to the guys at the door (sorry I didn't get your names). Breakfast was good with good choices offered.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, nice decor, good value”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyage90
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, this hotel is a great value for the price. Our room was not very large, but just the right size. It was quiet, clean and nicely decorated. The bed was very comfortable. Staff is very friendly and helpful. No complaint what so ever. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay but--”
Reviews.Author: jvcs
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Hampton Majestic. The staff were friendly and helpful, the service quick. Our only problem was the bottom sheet on our king-sized bed. I don't know what it's supposed to fit, but it goes only a couple of inches onto the mattress. As a result I spent both nights trying to refit it and avoid sleeping directly on the mattress. Please make sure the sheets fit the beds so as not to mar an otherwise great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, central location, and good value”
Reviews.Author: Planet_963
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Hampton Majestic and it was like a home away from home. The room is spacious and cozy, and the bed is extremely comfortable. It is very quiet because there are only a few rooms on each floor, and we hardly heard any noise from the street during the night. The staff is very attentive and friendly. The complimentary buffet breakfast is filling and the coffee is very good. We enjoyed the hotel as much as the rest of our stay. We would definitely consider staying there again and would not hesitate to recommend it. Everything that we wanted to see was within reasonable walking distance and we always felt safe. Our first trip to Chicago was excellent thanks in part to the Hampton Majestic. Free Internet access in the lobby was also very convenient. This is an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “More Bang for your Buck!”
Reviews.Author: TheRealBishops
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in November last year, for 4 nights. When searching for hotels this seemed too cheap compared to other hotels, so was worried we might be in for a nasty surprise when we got there. No such problem the room was large, quite and clean. The free breakfast was basic, but it certainly set us up for the day. Location is great for Macy's and also the underground. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a weekend.”
Reviews.Author: MObookworm
Reviews.Content: Met a friend for the weekend and we wanted a place to stay near everything. The rooms were very nice. My friend was able to check in early. I had called to request early check in and the staff member very helpful. The breakfast was great as well. We walked everywhere but the el stations were close if we needed them. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Paula468
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful night at the Hampton Inn Majestic Chicago! I was so impressed with the suite, the location and the wonderful staff. The valet were wonderful. Helping me with all of my bags and my cup of coffee! Denise at the front desk was awesome! She was so helpful and kind letting me know she was available for anything I needed. There were warm cookies at check in that were a nice treat coming in from a long day. I felt like I was living in a downtown condo. The suite was very nicely decorated and the beds were very comfortable with a lot of pillows. Can't wait to book another stay!

Reviews.Title: “reviews werent lying”
Reviews.Author: sean b
Reviews.Content: I was going to stay at a place literally right at twice the cost of this nearby, but instead I booked my flight a little early so that if this was a really horrid place, I still had plenty of time to take up my other reservation. No need. Surprisingly enough, these reviews were dead on. The rooms were clean, the staff was great. If this place had an expensive restaurant and lobby they'd be in the realm of rooms that charge twice or more. If you just want a room (thats all I want out of my hotels) thats safe, clean, and not expensive, this worked great. They display their TripAdvisor rating in the lobby, so being as they take it seriously and my stay was great, here's my review.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect combination of value and location...”
Reviews.Author: Slipstream
Reviews.Content: You cannot ask for a better location, or for that matter, value in a centrally located downtown Chicago hotel. Great staff, well maintained property, and a unique layout.* *When you by-pass the lobby, you feel as if you're living in a nice downtown apartment. A couple of clicks on TripAdvisor reviews had me booking a room. Evening check-in was smooth and took only a couple of minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sket101
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Majestic was a wonderful experience from the minute we entered the doors. The gentlemen at the front door were some of the nicest people we have ever met at a hotel. We enjoyed seeing them every morning as we went out for our adventures. The people at the desk were just as helpful. Our room was large and really quiet. Our room was the first from the elevator and we never heard a noise. This room in downtown Chicago was quieter than our house in the burbs. Breakfast had a hefty selection of food. While the hot food was standard fare of eggs and sides there was enough of other options to make it sufficent each day. Previous reviews talked about how crowded the breakfast area was but we were there for 3 days and did not see any congestion. Overall we were very happy with our decision to stay at the Hampton Inn Magestic.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: PicardNorthBay
Reviews.Content: Great location - minutes to the "bean" in Millenium Park. Close to the Art Museum. Close to Subway. Close to great restaurants ( Millers and Berghoffs). Very friendly staff. Clean, quiet rooms rooms. A great breakfast each morning. Easy valet parking. This place has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Majestic, Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MichTraveler_rus
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several times while visiting the Windy City. It's very reasonably priced for the downtown area. Parking is 42 dollars per day with in-out privileges, which again, very reasonable for downtown. Rooms are spacious and clean. Sound proofing is good, considering that you are in the heart of the Chicago

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Dianne N
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Chicago and we were very happy with this hotel. The location is close to Grant Park, Millenium Park and Michigan Avenue. Our room on the 21st floor was very quiet for a city hotel; rooms are not overly large but well maintained and the bed very comfortable. The staff is very knowledgeable and courteous. The breakfast area is cozy but the food selection is good and very well kept; we did not have a problem getting a table each morning of our stay. Easy access from the "L" (Monroe Station) which we took from O'Hare - $2.25 for each of us (one way) versus an expensive cab ride is the way to go. We look forward to a future visit to this wonderful city and we will definitely stay at the Hampton Majestic again.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Magic at the Majestic”
Reviews.Author: MrFoster
Reviews.Content: One of the great vertical hotels. More than 20 floors, but only 5 or 6 rooms per floor. Staff is extra courteous, rooms are clean. Beds are very comfy and the 19th floor was very quiest at night. The rooms are VERY tall. There are a few quirks: the floor in the room has an odd slant near the door. The toilet was not flushing when I arrived, but I chose to reconnect the flapper to the flush lever myself instead of calling maintenance. The elevators are rather small for the volume of guests and their luggage. As I have learned with all Hamptons: bring your own forks knives and cups. Hampton Inns have a seriously misguided belief that to be "green" they have to give their guests unusable paper cups and utinsels made out of some cheap plastic that is more flexible than cherry Twizzlers.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: likesthebigcities
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great...bell staff is awesome! Would def. stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Jean-Mert
Reviews.Content: + location, right in the center, close to Millenium park and metro lines (5 min walk from the metro line going to O'hare airport, costs you 2,45 USD per person vs 45 USD ride in cab) + size of the room and bath room + friendly and helpfull staff + good choice for breakfast - as mentioned by other reviewers, the breakfast room is actually the lobby and gets very crowded. Food and drinks served in plastic plates and glasses. This is really a minor inconvenience compared to the great value for money offered by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Look No Further!”
Reviews.Author: melmen37
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Majestic Chicago not only met our expectations, but far exceeded them! We could not have asked for a warmer welcome to Chicago then what we received from the entire staff and accomodations at this hotel! This was our first trip to Chicago and definitely won't be our last and we will be staying at the Hampton Inn Majestic which is conveniently located to just about everything to see or do in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: dapfunk187
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hampton Inn was really great - everyone, even the security guards, were very friendly and accommodating. We found out later during our stay that our flight was cancelled so we needed to extend our stay by 1 day - the receptionist was very helpful and was able to get this done quickly and painlessly at the rate we were already locked into. The rate was one of the best available and couldn't be beat based on the location. The hotel is less than a minute walking from 2 train lines (called the CTA in Chicago) so it was very convenient to travel around the city and to get their from the airport. Since this hotel is located in "The Loop" section of town, we were very close to Millennium Park and the art museum which we could walk to. The hotel room was very clean and spacious. Just as a tip to other travelers, this hotel does not have a pool but it does have a very small gym if you like to work out. There are 2 computers available connected to printers which is convenient as well. They offer "breakfast on the go" which is a bag of water, fruit, granola bar and muffin - this was great for the mornings that we were in a hurry to get on our way. If you have more time, stay for the hot breakfast which is also pretty good. They offer coffee all day every day in the lobby as well. We felt very safe and comfortable in this hotel so would definitely recommend it. My only complaint is that the water was highly chlorinated so after taking showers, that's all we could smell in our room. Other than that, all good things to say, still earning 5 stars in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Slapp
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from the Majestic and can honestly say that this is by far the nicest $129 a night hotel I hve ever stayed in. The rooms are very quiet and nicely decorated. The bathroom is huge and well appointed, the bed is glorious! My only complaint is that there are no glass glasses. The breakfast area was a little conjested this morning but was just loading up a tray to bring back to the room, no big deal. The location is great but we are walkers and don't mind the 10 minute walk to the MM.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Sarah S
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business and stayed at the Hampton Inn Majestic because of it's location, the free breakfast and internet, and the price. A great value and a friendly welcoming staff. I stayed in a king room that was spacious, clean, up to date, and well kept. My view wasn't great, but I wasn't looking for a room with a view. You can't beat the location right off State Street and close to many attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, close to the action, and reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: DeeandLolo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and comfortable, especially the bed. The decor was chic in a historic building giving it a great atmosphere. Breakfast in the morning provided a good variety and the coffee was delicious. The eating area was a little crowded, but we managed to find a table to enjoy our breakfast. It was within walking distance of several restaurants and Shoreline Drive. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, kind staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights with 3 small kids on an introductory Chicago trip. Nice, reasonably-priced hotel in the heart of The Loop, convenient to the parks and museums and Michigan Avenue. The bell staff were very kind to the kids, as was the lady at the front desk. Even though other reviews are correct about how small the breakfast area is, I'm still giving these folks 5 stars - because that is just a physical limitation of the building, and the staff otherwise works very hard to keep up with the swarm at the breakfast area. Probably the best advice is to just get up a little earlier to avoid the peak flow at breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed ...would recommend for sure!”
Reviews.Author: daytripperJ
Reviews.Content: A short weekend in Chicago. TA ranked the Hampton Majestic at #6, how could we go wrong? Let me start by saying that I hadn't been to Chicago is quite some time, and the hotel was a little further from where we wanted to be than originally thought. This however, is my own fault. While just a minute or 2 from Millennium Park, ...we were about 10-15 minutes from Mag Mile which starts just north of the river. A negative?? No, not really, but wanted to mention it. The staff was great. Helpful, cordial, accommodating, ..no complaints at all. The room was VERY clean, and very suitable for our weekend getaway! I can see why it's ranked so high with other TA people. The price is right for a very nice hotel that's just a touch off the beaten path of Mag Mile, but again ...like I said, not too bad. If I had to come up with a complaint it was not really w/ the hotel, but other people who stay there. The complaint is about the crowd at the breakfast the Hampton Majestic provides in the morning. Typical buffet style fare, but ...you know how people can get around food!! The area to serve the food, and sit down and eat was a little too small for the number of people attending. All in all, ...a great stay...would recommend, and may even stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions”
Reviews.Author: AlleyD2
Reviews.Content: Ok I am an avid T.A. person and read everything and review every place. I booked this hotel for this upcoming weekend August 19 â€“ 21 to celebrate my 20th anniversary. I booked this because of the reviews on T.A. I called the hotel today to confirm my reservation and was greeted by a very pleasant gentleman. I called, gave him my name, and he confirmed my stay and commented on it being my anniversary (glad he had it in the system). I told him I had a few things we were going to do early in the day and would arrive early, before the 3pm check in. This guy was very pleasent, he commented on the walking distance to the sites I wanted to see, the weather on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday, and stated we could utilize the parking service even if we come at noon and our room is not ready. I hope the stay is as good as my first impression. I will keep you all advised.

Reviews.Title: “Top hotel .. but with 1 issue :”
Reviews.Author: OCH_10
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights back in June this year with my parents. Booked 2 rooms. First of all, the location of that Hotel is unbeatable ! We landed at O'Hare airport after an 11 hour flight, bought 7 day passes at the airport and took the blue line train that brings you inside the loop (don't even think about getting a taxi.. you'll just get stuck in trafic jams). Get out at Monroe station. From there, it was literally just a 200m walk until you reached the Hotel. It's close to everything.. shops like Macy's and restaurants are literally within 5 minutes walk. Staff at the reception was increadibly friendly throughout the say and they pro-actively offered the code for internet access and gave us the magnetic cards for our rooms. You need to use those cards to use the lift.. which adds to the overall security of the Hotel. Rooms were spacious.. very clean.. fitted with a powerful aircon whose intensity can be customised to suit your needs. Now back to the issue which I mentioned in the subject and it concerns the breakfast lounge (which is effectively the reception) : It is far too SMALL for such a big hotel and the arrangement is poor !! Too few tables and seats (talking about half a dozen table max.) and as soon as you're having 25 to people having their breakfast, you'll have to queue or stand up while eating. If you can't get hold of a seat, then you're left with the sofas which take up the remaining space and which are definitely not comfortable when you're taking a breakfast. On the first morning, after 20 minutes queuing, we just decided to leave the breakfast lounge and took our breakfast in a nearby restaurant. That was the only disappointment I had with that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great service, Great location...”
Reviews.Author: ctespo
Reviews.Content: We wanted to do a lot while in Chicago and this hotel is in a central location close to all CTA lines (subways/trains). The desk staff recommended we purchase a multi-day CTA pass, so we bought 7-day passes for $23 each (one or two cab rides) and had unlimited city transportation. The rooms are updated and nice, breakfast is included, the staff is helpful and always provided good answers to our questions and good directions (the girl who takes care of the breakfast buffet, Saray, is especially sweet. Our first night (a Wednesday), I was a little concerned about walking from the subway to the hotel at night, but we didn't have any problems and the streets were more and more crowded as the weekend approached. Since this hotel is in the loop, most subway stops are only a block or two away. Millennium Park is a quick walk away (two blocks) and worth a visit. We had a delicious lunch at the Gage restaurant which is around the corner from the hotel and across the street from the park.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: Bad_Seed4
Reviews.Content: Happy with our stay, hotel well located, staff friendly; breakfast area very small and can be hard to get a seat on the weekend but would be easier if people didn't linger for ages or take up a table for 4 when there's only one of them!

Reviews.Title: “It's simple, and it's the best in the loop”
Reviews.Author: FairfieldCounty83
Reviews.Content: I stay hear every time I'm in the loop for business, which tends to be every six weeks. And I love it, there are only 9 rooms per floor, so you won't hear doors opening and closing all night like at larger hotels. It's always clean, quiet, and convenient to all parts of downtown. The prices definitely vary depending on the week (not the season). I've paid as low as $120 a night, and as high as $270 a night, it just depends on what's going on in the city that week. I love how it's a no frills, no restaurant and no bar hotel. So, it's never busy or loud. Though the mornings in the lobby can get busy for the breakfast since the lobby is small, but I'm never more than a minute to grab a free yogurt and coffee. I've tried other hotels in the loop, including The Wit, La Quinta, W Hotel, Burnham, and Allegro. And this one by far surpasses them all. All the amenities are well kept and presented, and I would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints...perfect location for Lollapalooza”
Reviews.Author: Stellar424
Reviews.Content: We just spent one night in this hotel while staying in Chicago for Lollapalooza. I have absolutely no complaints and I loved staying in this hotel. We would have loved to stay longer, but our budget wouldn't allow. The front desk was very friendly and both check-in and check-out were a breeze. The bed was very comfortable, the room looked newly updated, and was spacious enough for two people (we had a king-sized bed). Since the hotel was busy, they had extended the complementary breakfast for another hour. The breakfast area was crowded, but the hotel staff did an excellent job of keeping everything well-stocked. The breakfast was better than we expected. The location was absolutely perfect for Lollapalooza. We were only four blocks from Grant park, and the street the hotel is on had an entrance into the festival. The room was expensive, but when compared to other hotels in the same area, it was actually very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Evasgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really clean and so comfortable. It was a last minute reservatio and I am so glad that I stayed here. The staff was helpful and friendly. Check in and out were hastle free and the entire stay was a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Neat Hotel in Downtown Chicago. Check it out!”
Reviews.Author: D67
Reviews.Content: Decided to cruise down to Chi-Town for a long weekend as a little road trip to get out of this crazy city. Checked with my friends on TripAdvisor and found the Majestic Mile Hampton that looked pretty good and was priced pretty reasonably... so I booked it. Upon arriving, W Monroe Street was under some crazy renovation... so watch the pot holes and exposed manhole covers. The valet guys are really confusing but kind of funny and nice. Expect to pay $42/night for valet (or parking anywhere in the city) with in and out priveledges. There are homeless people sleeping in the parking garage so they make you take out your electronics and sign a waiver... I guess it's expected anywhere in any major metro city. We were in a nice 2011 sports car and didn't have any problems so I wouldn't worry about it. Reception is on the 5th floor - Angel at the front desk is awesome... really nice! Checking is a breeze and we stayed on the 20th floor. Not much of a view since we faced an office building but I didn't really care. Room is neat with pumpkin orange walls with high ceilings (20 ft?). We had 2 double beds with a 40 inch Samsung flat screen TV. Did the bed bug test and didn't see anything. The mattresses actually looked pretty new but were a little too soft for my liking. Sheets were crisp and clean and unsoiled. Bathrooms are clean with a granite counter top and nice hot and powerful shower. No complains on the room... nothing fancy but super clean, comfortable, and nice. Fitness centre is 'meh'. It's free 24/7... 2 treadmills, 1 eliptical, a cable station, and balance ball. They all have TVs built in so bring your headphones or use theirs with 'supplied ear covers' that were out of stock when I was there. I think that's kind of nasty anyway... who wants to wear some sweaty old headphones? Dang... Ice is available on every floor and drink vending machines are on every 2nd floor. FREE BREAKFAST! A lot of free breakfasts are $#i+ but this one is decent. There are waffles, potatoes, bacon, english muffins, toast, cheese danishes, apple danishes, fresh fruit, apples, bananas, oranges, raisin bran, cheerios, another bran cereal, blueberry muffins, decaf, robust, regular coffee, and herbal teas. Also a juice dispencer with apple, orange, and a mango/guava juice (I think). A nice perk is that coffee, tea, and some fruit is available complimentary 24/7 in the lobby. I made some good use of it! There are also pre-bagged breakfasts at the front desk if you have to grab one to go. Two computers located in the lobby for internet access but I didn't use them since there is free WiFi. Overall, I'd totally recommend. Clean, safe, convenient... can't ask for more. To put the cherry on the sundae, it's right downtown. You can walk to food, the Skydeck, Willis tower, and many of the other attractions. And if you like shopping, you can get to State street where shopping starts. There is a Forever 21 right on the corner followed by a T-Mobile, huge Macy's, Cartier, Disney Store, Puma.... Chicago is a great city that everyone should see. It's layed out nicely with FANTASTIC architecture and such a great character to it. The stuffed deep dish pizza is a must. Only caution is that in the downtown area on Friday and Saturday there are a lot of people asking for money at dawn and later.... but even so, I felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old Hotel in the Centre of the Theatre District”
Reviews.Author: minoumex
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Majestic is a lovely comfortable hotel right in the middle of the Theatre district and close to the Art Institute, and surrounded by many of the early skyscrapers by Sullivan, close to Haskell Building, Monadnock Building, and Willis Tower. They are beautiful with their art nouveau decoration, even Macys is the original with a domed roof and elaborate columns. It is also up the road from Millenium Park where all the cultural activities are, like the Art Institute, where we spent the afternoon (American Gothic, Sunday Afternoon at the Grande Jatte )etc as well as lovely Asian/American examples. There is an enormous open air pavilion with a huge lawn in front where this month they are holding free concerts. We went tonight for the concert with hundreds of families and young couples of all races and ages having their dinner on the grass and listening to the concert. Of course it is still light at 9pm in June. The silver pavilion, designed by the architect Frank Gehry is as imposing as his Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao. We were amazed how beautiful Chicago is with its Sullivan skyscrapers and ultra modern architecture and cultural activities in beautiful parks, lakeside walks, gardens and there are many cultural activities involving the whole community. The breakfast, wi fi and comfortable beds made this hotel an excellent choice n the centre of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good Economy-Class Hotel in the Loop.”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnLocation
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the great rating and reviews on TripAdvisor. Location was the clincher. Itâ€™s an easy walk to Millennium Park, Art Institute, Architecture Foundation tours, restaurants, shops, public transportation (Orange train from Midway took us right there). Well situated for viewing many important buildings and public art. Crossing the river to N. Michigan Ave. is only about a 15-minute walk. Since we were in Chicago to see the sights, this was most important to us. The hotel consists of the upper floors of the Majestic Theater (now Bank of America Theater). Our room, 802, was a good size, with one king bed, desk, dresser and flat TV. No refrigerator. Decor in both the bedroom and bathroom was dark. Housekeeping did an excellent job, and it always felt clean. In fact, while we were there the carpets were professionally cleaned, which is nice, but it meant walking around on squishy wet carpet one evening and inhaling cleaning fluid. The free buffet breakfast is standard fare, but was a big savings and allowed for a quick start out the door each day. I must commend Crystal, an outstanding employee who keeps the buffet freshly stocked and goes out of her way to accommodate any special requests. One word of warning - unless you get there around the time it opens (6am) you will be jostling with a crowd of guests crazed by the sight of free food. Free wireless internet is also a big plus, since fancier, more expensive hotels usually gouge you for this. There are also two computers in the lobby that are free to use, especially handy for checking in with the airlines. For security reasons, you need a room key to get to your floor but not to the lobby, which is fine, but because the hotel starts on the 4th floor, everyone found it challenging to get the hang of it. Abdoul, a downstairs bellman, was terrific in storing and retrieving our luggage after we checked out, and saw to it that our cab was waiting for us on time. Employees like this, who take pride in their work and go about it with a positive attitude truly make traveling a pleasure. We were disappointed that the hotel was unable to fulfill our request for a room on a high floor with a view. Since we were staying for five nights with the expressed purpose of studying Chicagoâ€™s architecture, it would have meant a lot to us, plus, the upper floors didnâ€™t appear to be full. I say this because the vending machines on our floor were sold out every evening, despite my reporting it to housekeeping, and it wasnâ€™t until I made my way to the 17th floor that I found a working machine. This happened every single evening. Overall, the price was competitive for decent downtown accommodations, the bed was comfortable, the room was quiet, and the hotel served as a good home base. I might shop around a bit though on the next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy rooms, quiet and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nomad77_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for pure pleasure for 4 nights. Chicago is a great city and you can stay very conveniently downtown, without paying New York prices... Had a great room, overlooking the Trump tower (thanks to staff for this! they put me on the high floor as requested and I had a very nice urban view). Room was super clean and the bed very comfy. Haven't heard a single sound or noise for the whole 4 days. Yes, perhaps for some, the dark color of the rooms interior is not adequate for any reason, but for me it was perfect, it shows a distinctive touch to the whole hotel design but also provided me with fantastic sleep and general feeling of coziness. Have I mentioned that it's very clean? There were some disadvantages though. Breakfast is included, however the breakfast area is very small and you can hardly find a place to sit. Breakfast itself was very ordinary, but the biggest minus from me is that they are using exclusively plastic cutlery and cups, not only in the breakfast area, but throughout the whole hotel. Since it was the earth day at the time, the plastic/foam didn't look very well at all. Parking: can be a big hassle. If you don't have a car it's probably perfect location, but with a car try to get the rate with parking included. It's a valet parking. The 3rd day of the stay there was a fresh scratch on the back of the car. Since it was rental car, I didn't care too much (insurance covered), but I guess the parking building is crammed and this can happen. All in all you are way better-off here without a car..

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Weekend/Cubs”
Reviews.Author: rwmdoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights.Great location downtown.Everyone was friendly and helpful.Rooms were very nice and well appointed.Free breakfast was good not great.This was our second stay and will probably stay again next time in town. Parking was $42 per day with in/out included.

Reviews.Title: “Dark rooms”
Reviews.Author: mbcbarrett
Reviews.Content: Maybe I just had a bum room given how the other reviews here read...but my room was small, dinghy carpet, and basically no window. The tall curtains tried to conceal the fact that half the window was a brick wall, and the part that was window was inches away from another brick wall. The housekeeping staff forgot their bucket and sponge in my room. I had to come back to the hotel very late and the outside door is locked. The bellhop watched me fumble around outside for a key for 5 minutes without opening the door (and trust me, I do not look like a security threat). This hotel also seemed to be popular with tour groups....which meant a drunken party outside my room one night. As a rule I enjoy Hampton properties, and this one had the ususal amenities - good breakfast, free internet, etc that I expect. And I know it's a renovated property with a history and that's cool...but I would've like a little more light and fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate....Great HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katakatakata
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel exceeded our 3* expectations. The location, the service, the room, the breakfast,....everything was GREAT!!!!! We spent a weekend with our family (2 adults and a 17 year old daughter) and the hotel served us well on ALL accounts. Don't hesitate....Chicago is a great city and this hotel, even better!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location and a great hotel in every way!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyjob
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with wonderful service. I stayed there on a business trip and it was My first time in Chicago. Everything went so well, the staff was so helpful. It was so easy to get around and I was close to many tourist attractions! Truly a Great place to stay, quite a value! I hope I get to travel there again!

Reviews.Title: “My Go-To Hotel for Chicago fun”
Reviews.Author: shess1025
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for my first visit to Chicago based on TripAdvisor reviews and you did not lead me wrong. This is a terrific hotel, super well-situated. As convenient as it gets ... centrally located in the Loop and the L trains and bus stops within a block. My room was on the 18th floor and the first room off the elevator and located next to the ice machine...that could have been trouble (for me) but instead, my room proved to be incredibly quiet. Plenty of room for me, nice desk to do a little work and plan out my day/night's fun. Lots of hot water. No weird smells. Very helpful and nice staff. A decent breakfast. It was sold-out most nights I was there (5 nights). I would, in a heartbeat, return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, clean, nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: haole739
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night at the tail-end of our week-long trip to Chicago. Pros: - free internet - free breakfast (it was actually pretty good, more than just pastries) - nice staff, clean rooms/bathrooms - good location Cons: - room was a little dark (but wasn't really a big deal) - walls are a little thin, but our rooms was connected to another, so not sure if that would be the case if the room wasn't connected We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Matt79765
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a long weekend of baseball and sightseeing. We found the Majestic to be very conveniently located near downtown attractions, restaurants, and the Red Line. It was also very reasonably priced considering the location. The room was a decent size and clean. The staff was friendly and very helpful. This was a great hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Huffy Travel, You've Done it Again!”
Reviews.Author: salerina
Reviews.Content: Check the internet for specials throughout the year. The rooms have been great every year. The beds very comfortable and clean. The front desk is very accomodating. The housekeeping staff was very friendly. Great location for the loop and theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It”
Reviews.Author: AnitaD2009
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the hotel on June 25th and stayed a week. The hotel was great for the price. The room price included a buffet breakfast, the nightly room fee and valet parking. The room was very comfortable and large. There was a king bed, a desk, a frig, and a large dresser (and there was room to walk). The entire staff was great. They all offered up great things to do and directions on how to get there. This hotel has a wonderful location. The CTA is on the corner, and so is the bus stop to take you across town. The hotel is also walking distance to great shopping, millenium park and great restaurants. We will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: suebeth8
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect. So close to Milennium Park and the Art Institute. Staff was wonderful, very helpful and friendly. Breakfast was great, nice to have so many options, and they always refilled as needed. Room very clean and very quiet. We had a refrigerator and a microwave which came in handy during our stay for the week. Would go back to this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and an architectural gem”
Reviews.Author: DixieIpsit
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight in May, 2011. Very impressed with the service that we received from everyone - starting with the bellman in the lobby through the very pleasant receptionist when we checked in and out to the staff that took care of the breakfast. The architecture is very interesting (a converted office building), the amenities in the bathroom first-rate, bed very comfortable. The colors in the room were a little dark for my taste (I go for light beiges!) but they fit with the style of the building and were well done.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, can't fault it.”
Reviews.Author: tomcoppinger
Reviews.Content: Booked this through hotels.com, $150 for the night, which seems a wee bit high, but if you want a high standard in downtown Chicago, then not a bad price. Very close to Monroe CTA station, popped out from underground, and saw it within 60 paces, across the street. Location is excellent. Booking in and out was no problem, staff were very nice. My room was on the 17th floor, and the elevator up was very brisk, not at all pokey. Confusing to find the lobby, NOT on the ground floor, as expected, but on the 5th floor. Doormen were helpful in putting me right, directing me to the elevator. Room was very clean and spacious. Very quiet, too. Climate control/air temp was spot on. Bed was very comfortable, slept with no problem. Bathroom was clean, and the shower gave hot and cold as expected. I was recovering from a long flight and jet-lag, having flown over from Ireland, so just to have these basics met was hugely gratifying. All I wanted was to watch a bit of TV, and collapse. Breakfast: they had scrambled eggs on muffins, and you could make waffles, and lots of fruit and other makings, toast, cereal, etc. It's included in the price, so might as well make a meal of it. Not fond of the paper plate and styrofoam cup scene, but no complaints. I went wandering the next day, and the doormen stored my bags for me, glad to have that service. No mention of a price, at face value, a free service, but I did tip them. If you can get a room here at a good price, it's ideal.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel right in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: queensgirl1963
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you are visiting Chicago. It may not look like much from the outside but its clean and fairly modern. The breakfast was great, lots of variety to choose from not just pastries and coffee and internet access was included. The beds and pillows were ultra comfortable and the room I had was very quiet!! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: rickiboston
Reviews.Content: A hidden gem in the Loop, this tucked away hotel offers what I need when traveling to Chicago for business. Nice rooms with tub and shower, ironing board and irons already in the rooms, great staff who check that everything is ok whenever they see me, comfy beds...basically, clean, quiet, comfortable, and helpful staff. Close to shopping, close to work, less than a block from the Blue Line CTA (direct to O'Hare), this is my first choice when I come to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not your usual Hampton Inn!”
Reviews.Author: perkypetfarms
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a unique space just above the Majestic Theater in the Theater District of Chicago. Although it's an old building, the rooms are up to date - modern decor that fits well within the building. No mustiness, rooms are large (ok, I admit I stayed at the Palmer House down the street a few years ago. A must-stay once in your life type of place, but rooms were small, dingy and musty.) Rooms and public areas also very clean and obviously well taken care of. Staff is wonderful - welcoming and helpful. You enter the hotel at street level and take the elevator to the 4th floor lobby. Several doormen are there to direct you to the lobby, help with luggage, call a cab for you. Friendly guys. The lobby is large and a complimentary breakfast is served - hot dishes (the three mornings I was there we had mini-omelettes and bacon, bagels with cheese and sausage, then scrambled eggs and bacon), toast, muffins and pastries, inst. oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, and fruit salad (yay!!!! grapefruit sections!!!) And free internet! Right in the loop, easy access to the L, the lakefront, restaurants, theaters, you name it.
