Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: AER245
Reviews.Content: My mother & I recently stayed 3 nights at the Hampton Inn Majestic in the theater district of Chicago. The hotel was perfect! Right in the middle of the Loop (breakfast included), near a really awesome pub (Miller's Pub), the Art Institute & Millenium Park. An El station within 2 blocks. The room was clean, spacious and most of all quite. Beds were very comfortable too. The gentleman who checked us in was so kind and helpful. When we asked about nearby restaurants, he happily printed out a list of choices which also listed how many blocks away the restaurants were from the hotel and save us his personal recommendations. This was my first trip to Chicago so I was happy to be located near so many 'must see' Chicago sites.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Megan_Adelaide_AU
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, lovely rooms of a good size. The breakfast each day was fantastic - continental but you can also make your own waffles. Great to fill you up for a big day of sightseeing. Good location for theatres etc, we will probably stay a bit closer to the magnificent mile next time round as it was about 25 walk to the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Great Location, and Classy Decor”
Reviews.Author: jwfoodog
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for one night after my flight out of O'Hare was cancelled. I arrived tired after spending most of my day at the airport. From the moment I arrived, I was greated with extremely friendly service that made me feel right at home! I was also very pleased with the room. The decor was very classy, and the room was very clean. As is often the case with urban hotels, the room was a bit small, but it didn't feel at all cramped. The bed was very comfortable. The internet worked very well. The hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of the Loop (downtown). It is less than a block from both the Red Line and Blue Line trains. There are also lots of stores and restaurants nearby. In spite of the location, the room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Oasis”
Reviews.Author: MyHomeIsMyself
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on business but fit some leisure in. From the second I arrived, jet-lagged and incoherent, I couldn't have been more happy with this place - their service was outstanding. Every single member of staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful, the rooms were warm, inviting and cosy and the beds were indeed heavenly just as they'd promised. The location is excellent, the wifi was fast and the breakfast took everyone's preferences into consideration. The fact that they leave fruit out 24/7, as well as the ubiquitous coffee, for their guests just goes to show that they think of little touches that will make their guests' stay comfortable. I loved my time here and have been recommending it to all my friends. If I ever go to Chicago again, I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: afortun81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn on April 22 and 23. Perfect location, close to everything. Great price for a lovely room that was big enough for myself and 3 adult daughters. Breakfast was generous and always fully stocked. Last but definitely not least, every single staff person we came in contact with was pleasant and went out of their way to be helpful. They were the best, and I only wish I could remember their names to thank them here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: smoky624
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its proximity to the Bank of America Theatre. You had to take an elevator to the lobby. The doorman were excellent and were helpful many times o how to find places. I honestly thought the hotel did not have many people staying there. It was extremely quiet (we were on the 10th floor) and I never saw anyone on my floor. I think there were about 9 rooms on each floor. This was definately not your traditional Hampton Inn - much more upscale. At breakfast in the morning it was packed. There were people in the hotel. We stayed 3 nights and were very pleased. Everyone went out of there way to make our stay pleasant. The breakfast offerred a large variety of items including one hot entree. The location was about 2 blocks from Millinieum Park and the Art Institute and a 10 minute walk from the Skydeck. There were several restaurants within walking distance. We also had fantastic weather the weekend we were there. I would not hesitate to stay at this Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff, Definitely Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: snelson1129
Reviews.Content: Great location, Friendly and Helpful Staff, Clean Room that were very modern, Loved the complimentary breakfast. The location was great; within walking distance to Michigan Avenue and many other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: TXPhD11
Reviews.Content: I was in town for business for 4 days. This hotel appealed to me since it is part of an old Chicago building and the Majestic Theater where Harry Houdini and Vaudeville acts once performed. The location was great, only a short walk to the river, restaurants all around, shopping all around, and right by metro transportation. Rooms were nicely-decorated and comfortable. Hotel itself doesn't offer room service, but there are two restaurants across the street who deliver and their menus are in the information book in the rooms. There is a decent free breakfast offered in the lobby each morning. Upon check in, the staff was attentive and caring. The female at the font desk, Keisha, was concerned right away that a male had called the front desk inquiring as to whether or not I'd have arrived yet and she wanted to make sure this wasn't a safety concern. I thanked her and told her it may very well be, and put a note in the system not to let anyone know my room number or to forward any calls to my room. She called up to my room later to check on me and she alerted the hotel security about the call. I felt very safe at this hotel, as the room floors were not accessible by elevator without key. Sure enough, late that night, an ex boyfriend who had known I would be in town came to the hotel and attempted to get a key to my room. He told them he was a guest too but I must have just forgotten to put his name on the reservation. Thanks to the caring and alert staff, he was unable to convince them of this and he was escorted out by security, thank goodness. Each evening someone from the hotel called to check on me, which was very nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a long weekend in Chicago. The Hampton Inn Majestic is a great property in a good location-great for walking to many places-shopping, Millennium Park, The Art Institute, etc. We had a triple room with 2 queen beds-very large room with nice amenities, flat screen, free wi-fi, coffee maker-loads of space in the bathroom to put things-very comfortable. We also booked a room for our newlywed son and his wife-they had a large room with a king. Very comfortable beds and pillows too. Besides the great location, the entire staff was so friendly and helpful-always smiled and said hello and made you feel welcome. When we arrived on Friday, we asked for a recommendation for a restaurant nearby--Pizanos-excellent-we even went back. The great value for us-since there were 5 of us-was the free breakfast! I was expecting just toast and coffee-but NO! They had something hot each morning plus make your own waffles-fresh fruit-very delicious-and bagels, cereal, muffins, different juices too. The area to eat breakfast did get crowded, but we managed to find space for all of us. We also found out that the Blue Line metro was just around the corner-we were able to use it to return directly to O'Hare airport for $2.25 each!! It took less time than the shuttle van!! We saved a lot of money on the return. There are stairs-but we had small suitcases. All in all-they are doing a great job at this hotel-Excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “It is all true - Hotel muito bom - PreÃ§o acessÃ­vel”
Reviews.Author: Claudio-1967
Reviews.Content: Very well located, nice staff. My room had no special view, but was clean and really quiet. Excellent sleeping quality. Breakfast is OK and included. If I need to return to Chicago I will stay there

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Goober21
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel and helpful staff. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: stebog
Reviews.Content: Another shout out for Juan at the front desk. Quick with good recommendations. The Bellman/valets were super, wish I would have gotten their names. Super dinner recommendations and quick with the car. Thank you guys!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, staff and breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: redrunner4
Reviews.Content: My son and I recently stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The location was PERFECT; we walked to everything except the MSI, whose Metra stop was very close by. The staff was VERY accommadating, from letting us check in early (we walked from Union Station), to giving us great restaurant recommendations, walking routes, nighttime safety info and just generally making my 11 yr old feel cool. And they ALWAYS seemed to be in a good mood (particularly the doormen, but really everyone we came across)! The room was great....very clean; wi-fi was great in planning activities for the next day. Breakfast was great as well, with a good selection for both adults (yogurt, fruit, excellent coffee) and kids (fresh make your own waffles, muffins, eggs, cereal, etc). It was nice to see a breakfast that wasn't about donuts and other low-nutrition staples. And the food/coffee was refreshed/replenished constantly. I left my coat hanging in the closet when we left, and called the next day and housekeeping had it and it was Fed-Ex'ed to me promptly. VERY much appreciated!! A wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Consultant”
Reviews.Author: jj1chit
Reviews.Content: The quality of service was excellent! The professionalism given by Juan C was outstanding. This Hotel was peaceful, clean and the staff made you feel at home. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect and truly "majestic"”
Reviews.Author: naturallyme76
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfecct hotel..perfect location...very friendly staff! Arrived not knowing what to expect but when we opened the door to our room and saw how clean and comfy it looked, there was a sigh of relief! No noise...matter of fact the hotel was completely booked and the only time I ever saw people was at breakfast. The hotel lobby is tiny...the complimentary breakfast was good with a little bit of everything..only complaint is the breakfast area is in the lobby so it was crowded and hard to find a seat. Stayed in room 1703 for four nights and most times we could catch the elevator stra8 up and down with no stops. Bus station across the street, the Red and Blue line rails just a couple minutes walking. Really enjoyed the stay and would stay there again when in Chicago!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sthompson1971
Reviews.Content: My two best friends and I recently spent 4 nights at the Hampton Inn Majestic and we absolutely loved it! The hotel was in a great central location and both the bus stops and train stations were easily accessible. It was also very reasonably priced. The free hot breakfast was good too. It wasn't The Yolk, lol, but for free it was good. There was a variety of items...eggs, breakfast meats, fresh fruits, muffins, bagels, etc. The desk staff wasn't the greatest on giving directions and we learned very quickly to rely on the door men. They were very friendly and very helpful. We enjoyed Chicago so much that we are already planning another trip in the next few months and we will definitely be back at the Hampton Inn Majestic!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: MDHolmes
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hampton Inn Majestic numerous times and it is consistently one of the best places to stay in the Loop with free internet access, free breakfast and right down the street from one of my favorite restaurants, Vivere.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tnbookhout
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Majestic was perfect for my five night stay in Chicago during a recent convention. The conference itself was at the Hilton Chicago, 3/4 of a mile away, and the bus stop directly in front of the Hampton let me pick up a bus that went directly to the Hilton. I also literally was around the corner from the blue line train that took me back and forth to O'Hare Airport. There are several excellent restaurants of various price ranges within a couple blocks. Many great stores just as close also. The rooms are a great size and attractively decorated, with a large HD TV and new furniture. Extremely clean and nice bathrooms. The free breakfast had a wide variety of hot and cold foods...not like the skimpy continental breakfasts of some hotels. Free wireless and ethernet Internet connections a real nice bonus. My friends at other hotels paid much more and got much less than I did!

Reviews.Title: “A fine place to stay in downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: BertDC
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine, nothing special. But a $139 per night rate in downtown Chicago is what sold us. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable, and Hampton Inn has a good (and free!) hot breakfast. The Magnificent Mile would be a more desirable location than this hotel, but I think you end up paying for it. Location was a short (but cold) walk to the Magnificent Mile area.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at a reasonable cost....”
Reviews.Author: cwill29
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past weekend while touring the sites of the city. We had room 1406, small but quaint with a recent reno it was clean and practical. We had a nice king bed. Continental breakfast offered daily was actually simple but quite good with a variety of eggs, sausage, yogurt, bagels, fruit, juices, coffee etc. The Majestic Building itself is stunning despite the simplicity of the rooms. It was a great place to hang our hat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: akm107
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a hidden gem. I wasnt expecting such luxury from a Hampton! The rooms are very modern with modern fixtures in the bathroom. The beds were extremely comfortable, as well as the pillows. Although I was only here for an evening (I work in the vacinity and was put here during the snow storm of 2011), i'd recommend this stay to anyone as the price is great. For those traveling from out of town, its a great place to stay in the Central Business District. You are near the shopping on State Street, Broadway in Chicago Theatres, and many many restaurants and attractions such as the Sears Tower. Highly highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big savings”
Reviews.Author: HBarros
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel from Dec 28 through Jan 3. In our opinion, it's the best location ever! It's just a 2 minutes walk from Millenium Park and The Art Institute, next to lots of good restaurants and shops, and the subway and buses just on the corner. Very good complimentary breakfast, making us skip all the lunchs. The staff: very good people, always prestative, goog humor (something we think it's also importante). We'll definetilly returning to this hotel next time in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: desikage
Reviews.Content: What more can I say, it's in a nice building, and for the price, worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “one of best.”
Reviews.Author: oopss
Reviews.Content: i am having a blast staying here i will be here for 2weeks and arrive yesterday and this has top my 5! its my 3rd time here and its unforgetable i will be back !

Reviews.Title: “So nice, we stayed there twice!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen12345
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel. The location is perfect for anything you want to do in downtown Chicago. The staff are all very friendly, the rooms clean and very secure. The complimentary breakfast is far more than just a danish and coffee...there was a nice selection of fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal, fresh waffles and beverages. The dining area was very clean. The complimentary high-speed wireless internet was a nice bonus. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jgmanti
Reviews.Content: I decided to take my family to Chicago for Christmas and stayed at the Hampton Inn Majestic for 2 nights. I had an excellent experience staying here.All the employees were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and very comfortable. This hotel is conveniently located near a lot of Chicago's attractions and Downtown. Excellent Breakfast, very healthy as well. When I come back to Chicago, I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan_1974
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for one night because we were going to a show in the area. For the price, the location of this hotel really can't be beat. Our show (in the Chase Auditorium) and dinner were literally around the corner. The next morning we went shopping on State Street which is a 1/2 block from the hotel. Great restaurants, great shopping, and great entertainment all within minutes of this hotel. Grant park, the Art Institute, and Michigan avenue are also just blocks away. The rooms were nice, clean, and modern. Although they were a little on the small side, they were definitely large enough. I think Internet access is complimentary in the rooms but we didn't bring our laptops so we didn't test it. They also have free computers in the lobby (along with coffee, hot chocolate, tea, and juice complimentary 24/7). Breakfast is also complimentary in this hotel. However, they don't exactly have room service. A nearby restaurant provides room service (but only from their menu), and they do not serve breakfast in your room. You must go to the lobby for the breakfast. Not really an inconvenience, just a heads up if you like breakfast in your room as we were hoping to do. Valet parking is $42/night; but we were able to park there beyond the check-out time the next day, which was nice. For the price, it's hard to find a better hotel in the loop.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: runner627
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good location. It would have been a great place to stay in the summer since it is within walking distance to great shopping and restaurants, although it was too cold to walk anywhere while we were there! It was very peaceful and quiet, we didn't hear any traffic or noise from the theater while there. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant inside, but they had a menu for a place called Italian Village where we ordered room service for a decent price. The hotel also had a continental breakfast in the morning, which was very tasty! The staff (valet and front desk) were all very friendly and prompt. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: grandhavenpaul
Reviews.Content: Located in nice area (theater district) reasonably close to the Magnificent Mile. All of the staff were very helpful and knowledgeable, particularly Juan and Keisha. Room and common areas always neat and clean. I love Hampton Inn's guarantee, which they post very conspicuously, that they will refund your full cost if not 100% satisfied with your stay. That's really putting your money where your mouth is. I certainly would have taken them up on it but was completely satisfied, especially considering the price. Will likely stay there again on our next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place in the Chicago Loop”
Reviews.Author: Weston66
Reviews.Content: Not sure what I can add to all the good comments already expressed here below -- but I pretty much agree with all of them. Just pan through all the complimentary headlines of the reviews. So I just want to add another "recommend" to their list here, because they deserve it. I am a Hilton Honors member, and a regular Hampton customer, and this one did not disappoint. It's elegant. This is a great location to stay in downtown Chicago, at a very reasonable price -- I even had a package deal that included free valet parking, and parking is a big deal in downtown Chicago. The valet parking attendants were very helpful and congenial guys. Breakfast was good, as Hampton's always is -- plenty of tables. I would certainly stay here again the next time we are down in the Chicago Loop.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale look and feel on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: jomama0121
Reviews.Content: I have seen The Hampton Majestic advertised on travel sites but had never stayed there. Such a nice surprise! Upscale, boutique decor, excellent service from the valet to the front desk, to the breakfast hostesses, and a really great location in the heart of the theater district. The bathroom was so beautiful, and the beds were comfy and cozy. The only thing I could say bad was that I could hear my neighbors and their wake-up call, but this didn't really keep me from enjoying a great night's sleep! Definitely recommend this hotel and I WILL stay there next time I am in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't be happier!”
Reviews.Author: sleepless55
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over the Thanksgiving weekend and could not have been happier. We had 2 adults and two adult children. The location is fantastic: in the loop within walking distance of the Miracle MIle, the Art Institute, Milennium Park, restaurants, ell stops, the Thanksgiving Parade and theaters. You won't find heated towel bars, fluffy terry cloth robes or a mini bar in your room, so if only the best will do for you, then this is not your kind of place. What you will find is very clean, comfortable, nicely decorated rooms, reasonable rates, free breakfast, free wireless, a small, but adequate workout facility, and friendly, non-obsequious help. We had one room with a king sized bed, which was not spacious, and one with two doubles, which was much larger. I would recommend the two doubles. There are only about 9 rooms per floor, so there was much less hallway noise than in some larger hotels. If you want to stay somewhere decent, but don't want to pay an arm and a leg, this is a great spot. I would definitely go back. If there is any drawback, it is that the parking (valet only) is $42 per day with in and out privileges. I did note that parking one block away at the Palmer House was $51 per day, so it could have been worse. There is lots of transit. If possible, leave your car at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyconan
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly staff 24 hours a day. They let us check out an hour later, and we were so grateful for that! The only thing was their public computers were old and did not have adobe installed to print a coupon we needed. Upgrade those and it will be perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great room”
Reviews.Author: bschma
Reviews.Content: A one-night business stay to scope out Chicago for future transfer here. This hotel was perfectly located in the heart of Chicago close to new office and close to Joffrey Ballet and shopping. I had read the staff was friendly so I asked as many stupid questions about the area that I could and they answered without a blink. The room was nice if a little dark, and about what one would expect of a Hilton product. I would without equivocation recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Marathon”
Reviews.Author: eleazarpl
Reviews.Content: Best Hotel if your are running the Chicago Marathon......only steps away from the Start and Finish Line.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel ever in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Marathon82
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central downtown and has the best shopping and dining experiences. The hotel is right by the water (Lake Michigan) and is only a walk away from every amenity possible. The hotel services are unbelievable and we were treated extremely well at this hotel. Thank you for the most fabulous stay....

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ROACHICAGO
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Majestic is extremely comfortable, offers a good, free full breakfast and is an absolutely perfect location. I had one of the "suite" rooms and we used it as sort a hospitality suite as there was a small group of us who had all arrived in Chicago to attend the theater adjacent to the hotel. It could not have been more perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: amyldh
Reviews.Content: The location can't be beat: just a few blocks from several El stops and fabulous State Street Shopping. The valet and front desk staff were some of the nicest I have ever encountered. They were very genuine in their efforts to make sure we had a wonderful stay. The property itself is wonderfully done (I belive it was an old bank at one time?) There was no show going on at the Bank of America Theater next door, so our night there was very quiet, as far as any noise coming from the street (rare for Chicago!) I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Truely a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yorkie60
Reviews.Content: looked at some of the other reviews and this hotel is great. the location is really good for getting around on the local transport. - we purchased our visitor passes at the ohare airport - $23 for 7 days unlimited travel on CTA. The train from Ohare was covered with the ticket and the hampton was only around the corner saving us the $45 dollars in a taxi!! one way The hotel was clean the staff very friendly advised were to eat etc . A really good breakfast was included my hubby even ventured to make waffles one morning - very busy at the weekends though. Coffee and tea was available all the time ~Our room was clean and tidy and although at the front traffic noise was not a problem. I gave 4 stars as we were unfortuately next door to a couple who were arguing very loudly most of the night would definately stay here again if we ever go to Chicago again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mwesth
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, extremely friendly and helpfull staff. The location is perfect, close to busses, EL and subway, and a lot of good places to eat nearby. Free coffee and fruit in the lobby 24/7

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Palmer House (which is across the street and down one block) when I'm in Chicago, but chose this hotel because they had a better rate. My experience here was every bit as pleasant as my stays at the Palmer House. This Hampton Inn was clean, quiet, in a great location on Monroe (a short walk to several mass transit lines, walking distance to Art Institute, State Street shopping, Magnificent Mile, Union Station, Sears/Willis Tower, etc.), and with a friendly staff (front desk, valet staff, housekeeping). Our room was very large with a fridge, microwave, tea and coffee service, sofa, and large desk. The lobby has a computer and printer for printing boarding passes. You enter on the Ground level (which is next to the lobby of the Bank of America Theater) and go up one floor to the reception desk. Parking (valet only) is $42 for a 24-hour period, but we got a room rate that included parking for only $15 more per night.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelsalot22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last December and I can't say enough about this hotel! The location is perfect, the staff is incredible, and the rooms are beautiful! This is not a typical Hampton Inn, it's 5 Star Quality! As soon as I walked in the door, I was greeted by a concierge who took my bags for me so I wouldnt have to lug them around any longer. I went up to check in, where I was given an upgraded room type. I arrived in my room, and was amazed. Beautiful colors, stylish decor, amazing view! I had to check my key card again to double check that this was in fact a Hampton Inn. The only thing I would change is the breakfast. I was there on a very busy weekend, so breakfast was packed. Not much sitting room, and I couldnt get near the buffet because there were too many people. I decided to venture out and eat somewhere Chicago-like instead..(when in Rome, right?). If you go to Chicago, I HIGHLY recommend that you stay here...I know I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: travelergo
Reviews.Content: Was here in business for 3 nights Sept 21-Sept 24. Pull up to the hotel and the valet immediately takes your lugguage from the taxi. No lobby inside just elevators and valet. Was told Lobby is on 4th floor and the valet took me and my luggage to the lobby. I could have done that myself but I tipped the valet. I checked in early and was glad to have a room at 1 pm. Got Room on 16th Floor. Room was small compared to other hotels I stayed in. Room was clean. Shower pressure was great. Towels were very worn and thin. Very difficult to wash my face due to the shape of the sink and bending over it. The bed was too soft for me as were the pillows although the flyer on the bed said you have both firm and soft pillows. To me they were too soft. Woke up each day with a sore back and neck. Was woken every night from people in the hall and talking loudly. Could hear everything from the room next door as well. I solved that problem by blasting the air conditioner on high to drown out noise. It was 90 degrees when I was there and when I would come back after a long day, I would find my AC shut off and the room was very hot. Housekeeping would shut my AC off everyday. My 2 collegues arrived later that day and there was a mix up regarding the reservation but they wound up on the 12th floor and they also found the towels thin and the beds too soft. I didn't eat the free breakfast but did go down to get tea every morning before I headed to my business meetings. All in all it was a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: voyageur415
Reviews.Content: For a recent trip to Chicago, I chose the Hampton Inn Majestic for the same reasons that I usually choose Hampton Inns: for a no-frills hotel, they are extremely dependable and do an excellent job. My room - beautifully renovated, by the way; not your average hotel decor, by any means - was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the free breakfast buffet was more than adequate, although tables sometimes were completely filled at peak hours. Located just about in the middle of the Loop, it was easy walking distance from most everything and extremely close to public transportation, when needed. There were plenty of restaurant choices around, as well. Being smack downtown, the location felt very safe and outside urban noise was never a problem. The staff were knowledgeable and friendly, even offering to throw a (clean) wet t-shirt in the staff dryer for free, instead of charging me to have it laundered offsite when not needed. Some Hamptons do offer coin laundry for guests; this one did not but I thought that gesture was extremely accommodating and not something your average hotel would suggest...more props to Hampton for going above and beyond. For my three-night stay, I booked directly on the website and was quoted about $200/night for the first two nights and $300/night for the final night. I thought that perhaps I could have found a cheaper room for the final night but since the location was practically unbeatable and I didn't want to take time from my vacation to pack/check out/shlep luggage/check in again, etc., I stayed put. I still think I got my money's worth since a cheaper property probably wouldn't have had the four-star location or convenience (the Majestic is really just a couple of blocks away from the Palmer House, whose rates were 75%-100% more per night than what I paid). All said, I had a great time and would definitely consider staying here on my next trip, or I may give their Mag Mile location a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: VADeels
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was excellent. Desk clerk gave us directions, advice on attractions and food, and made our stay very pleasant. Valet staff was also great. Would definitely choose this hotel for another Chicago visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean, Helpful Staff, nice linen, all in all great value”
Reviews.Author: forbes_500
Reviews.Content: This Hotel provides everything you need for a comfortable stay in Chicago. It is in a good location for getting around. It is a 'stay' location (ie not a hotel with restaurant, bar etc although they do provide a complementary "continental" breakfast.) I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Must stay while in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: shumanka
Reviews.Content: Great location to downtown art and entertainment. The staff was exceptional. Rooms were comfy. The next morning we did NOT feel as if we had just slept at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in the Hampton Inn Majestic in August 2010. The hotel is located very close to the Monroe station on the blue subway line. We took the subway to and from O'Hare airport which was about 40 minutes away. It was easy and at cost of $2.25 per adult one way, it was a far cheaper alternative to a taxi. The entrance to the hotel is small as the lobby is situated a few floors above the theatre. We stayed on the 11th floor in a room that contained 2 queen beds. We found it quite spacious, the beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was good with plenty of space around the sink for toiletries. The breakfast was okay, it is included in everyones room rate. There were a few hot items and breads, cereals etc. The area does get quite busy though. The hotel is in a very good location just a few minutes walk from Millennium Park. We loved our trip to Chicago it was even better than expected. The museums such as The Field & Art Institute are very good. Chicago is an excellent destinations for families as there are many interactive attractions for the kids. We will certainly be back as there is still more to see. To save on the attractions we bought the citypass. Also have a look on the explore Chicago website as they have visitor discounts for various attractions & shops. Thank you to the staff member that helped with taking our bags to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: MarcusLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great hotel. The location is excellent, the room was fairly standard but in very good condition and very comfortable. The price for the area was very competitive. In the lobby there is coffee on tap 24 hours a day, and it was very welcome and very nice. I don't usually bother with breakfast but at this hotel it is included in the room rate. People seemed to be enjoying it, and it was very popular. The public area was very comfortable and welcoming. All of the staff were friendly, but the reception staff were exceptionally good. I stay at a lot of hotels and it is incredibly rare that I'm ever remembered by name - at this hotel they did, and I was really impressed. Will definitely stay here again when I'm next in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in prime location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: maclil
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Majestic while on a trip to the Chicago area. The hotel was well located. We were close to Millenium Park and the lake. We were able to walk to fine restaurants and enjoy the city. Service was very good. The concierge was both helpful and entertaining. Breakfast was, as in most Hamptons, very good. All in all, a great value if you are staying in the city. The only negative is the cost of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel that has it all - great location, beautifully clean rooms, awesome customer service!”
Reviews.Author: dctrips
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great customer service and a terrific location. The quality of the customer service started over the phone when I requested adjoining rooms for our families â€“ they made the accommodations and booked these rooms for us a week in advance. Also, just asking one of the clerks downstairs if they could bring us a fridge â€“ he remembered our room number and within ten minutes, we had a fridge in our room! The hotel is just blocks to Millennium Park and Grant Park, just 1 block from bus and metro which made it very easy to get around. The only downside was the cost of the parking, but fast, friendly valet service and it was very convenient. The rooms were spacious, clean and very well-appointed with modern dÃ©cor and flat-screen tvs. Would come back here anytime! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been more pleasant”
Reviews.Author: stl-sue
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Chicago for a couple of days to shop do enjoy museums. This hotel was located near everything we wanted to do plus the theaters. The staff provided directions and helped make our trip even better. The room was lovely and the few rooms/floor added to the quietness for such a busy area.

Reviews.Title: “I would definately return to the Majestic!!!”
Reviews.Author: mescheem
Reviews.Content: We felt safe and comfortable. The staff was completely helpful being it was our first time in the Windy City. The rooms were super clean and homey. The vallet service was also wonderful and speedy, however a little pricey for this small town girl. The location was perfect!! We walked to the Navy Pier, Sears Tower and there are stores and fine dining all around it. Museums are only a 5 dollar cab ride away. I loved Chicago and this hotel only made our stay better!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the Middle of the Action”
Reviews.Author: Palomino52
Reviews.Content: This was for Anniversary weekend, and I haven't been to Chicago in years. We took a flyer on staying downtown because of the great rate and high reviews of this hotel via trip advisor (versus Magnificent Mile). This isn't a elegant hotel of The Palmer House ilk, there is no grand entrance - they offer free breakfast buffett in the lobby. In contrast, all things about the rooms are modern, sleek, clean, and stylish, which exceeded my expectations of even a Hilton flagship stay. For that I rate this hotel a 4, which would be a higher grade than I would rate a previous stay over a decade ago at The Palmer House. Because of the hotel's central location we were able to exclusively travel on the L-train, no changing lines from O'Hare, straight to hotel, and from hotel straight to Wrigley Field, and all around town. Most of the city sites (Sears Tower, Millennium Park) were only a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable & modern rooms, wish it were cheaper”
Reviews.Author: sweetpea101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Majestic for one night and had a fabulous experience. Perfect location and super modern rooms. I'm always looking for a deal so my only wish is that it could be cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Well Run at Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Trogons
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the theater district south of the Chicago River. It is a bit remote from the main attractions on Michigan Avenue. The room was of good size. No in room safe or refrigerator. Bed & Linens were high quality. Adequate drawers. Bathroom including shower, towels, sink location and counter space were good. Limited TV channel selection. Front staff very helpful. Included breakfast was above average quality. Heating, ventilation, and air conditioning worked fine. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel all around”
Reviews.Author: Chocolate091
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago. I booked at this hotel based on price and reviews from trip advisor. The room was great and so was breakfast. We did stay on the 14th floor(but really the 13th floor). And nothing strange happened. We were close to Milleunum Park. The only downside to where we were staying is we were in the theater district/finanical area which means stores close much earlier than other parts of the city. Also, parking is really expensive. It was 42 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - great location, beautiful room, central to everything”
Reviews.Author: TreyAnastasio14
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Extremely easy to get here from O'Hare (follow the signs, jump on the Blue line - it only goes 1 direction - and get off at Monroe). Only $2.25 to get there, and it's faster than the cab! The location is perfect, a close walk to the park. The room was in amazing condition, the breakfast was good and the staff always helpful. I would definitely stay here again! For a great bite to eat, the grill directly across the street was a pretty good spot. And don't miss out on the double-decker bus tour. The hop on/off feature was a great part of the trip. You get to see and experience a lot of Chicago, and for $35 for 3 days you can't ask for much more! I'll be back to this hotel for sure. I strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best value, no-frills hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: briankLakeStevens_WA
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for our five night stay. It's in the middle of the theater district, half a block from the red line subway to Wrigley and U.S. Cellular Fields, a short walk from Grant Park and the lake shore, and within two blocks of the Magnificent Mile. It serves a hearty, full breakfast, the rooms were spacious, clean and quiet, and the staff was outstanding. When we go back to Chicago, we'll stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: snoopy647
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and loved everything about the hotel. Location could not have been better. Walking distance to theatres, Millinium Park, Art institute, River cruise terminal for Architecture tour and the Willis Tower (Sears). Front desk staff and bell hops were very helpful with directions, taxis etc. Although no fridge in room, they offered to put our liquid refreshments in their fridge to stay cool. Would definately stay again and recommed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: mom2amywill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hampton Majestic during a family vacation to Chicago. The location was central and ideal for multiple sightseeing destinations on foot including Millineum Park and the Art Institute. We appreciated the friendly staff--especially Juan who was always willing to assist and advise us. It would be ideal to attend a show at the Bank of America Theater as it is right above the Theater. However, there weren't any shows at the time we were visiting. The breakfast, included with the room was nice and changed a bit each day.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location. Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: washmont
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, this being our first trip to Chicago. We drove; It is a bit hard to recognize the hotel because they have a small sign. We used our cell phone to call and they helped us find the place (we had a GPS). Basically just stop right at the Bank of America Theatre as the Hotel is part of the building. The valet-bellhop was very helpful Valet parking is $42, public parking is several blocks. Nice breakfast which is included as is Internet which worked well. The hotel is 4 blocks to Grant Park. We didn't eat at the place accoss the street but did enjoy having a couple of glasses of wine there street side. Several places to eat close by. Typical Hampton quality rooms. Helpfull staff!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Bon007voyage
Reviews.Content: This is an old building, with some of the olden artifacts preserved, like the mail chute etc. Nothing can beat this location. It is right in the center of downtown Chicago and a lot of the sightseeing and shopping is in a 2 mile radius. The rooms are rather small and lack some of the accepted modern amenities that are now more a necessity, however the location makes up for it. They provide a reasonably decent hot breakfast and all room service is provided through Italian village. Free internet available whichmakes it comfortable short term business stay friendly. The staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Mike in Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Very clean and interestingly designed hotel in a perfect location. Lots of things in a few blocks, including a short walk to Millennium Park, the Art Institute, and so on. Easy transit connections. Good breakfast. Elevators got a bit backed up around 9AM but otherwise no issues at all. Nicely designed rooms with very comfortable beds. Ideal home for a Chicago outing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in an Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: BillandWendyB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great stay here. This was our first stay in Chicago. The hotel was excellent, rooms were clean and nice, beds were fantastic. Service was great, breakfast was excellent. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful especially Simon down at the front door. Any time we needed to know anything we asked Simon and he would have the answer. Walking distance to just about everything. Great place to stay and we will definately go back there if we ever get back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: pnr315
Reviews.Content: We were out of the train, in a cab to the hotel and into our room in 15minutes. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean comfortable and well appointed. The location can't be beat, easy walk to Millenium Park, the river and loop trains. We stayed at the beginning and end of our midwest trip and it was perfect both times. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Great Location, Good Rates, Free Breakfast...”
Reviews.Author: sfaust77
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. The rooms were clean and spacious, nice beds and bedding. Customer service was top notch! Included free hot breakfast. Location is perfect for the downtown loop, with-in walking distance of many venues. Centrally located near blue line and redline subway for easy access. Con - No pool...

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: pumpkinfall
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with the Hampton in the Chicago District. We flew into O'hare airport and took the blue line to within half a block of the hotel. We also went to a Cubs game and caught the red line within half a block. It is an easy walk to Millennium Park. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. I felt comfortable and safe the entire visit.

Reviews.Title: “A Hampton Inn in the Center of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Jack37
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn fans will find the usual amenities in this hotel â€“ well-appointed rooms, styrofoam breakfasts, helpful staff, and reasonable prices. The great advantage of the location is that it is just around the corner from the Monroe stop on the CTA line from Ohare, so taxis are not necessary to get there. Get a multiple-day bus pass and use the 151 bus around the corner for the 10-minute ride to North Michigan Avenue. When we came out of the subway and tried to find the hotel, nobody in the neighborhood seemed to know where it was, so weâ€™ll tell you: it has a small entrance right next to the big theater marquee on Monroe. (Itâ€™s in a converted office building, with the lobby on the fourth floor.)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SuisseGal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a winner. Fanstaic location, just a few blocks from Union Station and close to Grant Park, shopping, and all the major museums. Tons of resuarants, from fast food to fancy, within a few minutes' walk. Customer service was superb - the entire staff was friendly, enthusiastic and service-oriented. Excellent breakfast. Hotel is small but very clean. My only two minor complaints were: 1) They ran out of cut fresh fruit about an hour before the breakfast bar closed, even though on my intial trip down when the area was just opened they assured me there would be plenty of food. Had I known, I would have taken some fruit right then. 2) I clearly heard my neighbor's wake-up phone call every morning, although I admit that I never did hear my neighbor. Made me wonder what would happen if I had gotten noisy neighbors, or a family with small children, next door. I think I may have been lucky. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Location and Value.”
Reviews.Author: Hosta_La_Vista
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised to have the ease of getting off the plane at O'Hare airport, having to pay $2.25 for a subway train that took us directly across the street (Monroe and Dearborn) to the Hampton Inn. it couldn'tbe easier - Chicago is very much that way. The hotel is a historic hotel in the 'Loop, section of downtown Chicago. The waterfront is a short 10 minute walk from the hotel, although I have to say, that is the shortest of all the walks you will complete in this city. A basic hotel, with decent basic rooms. Nice clean white duvet covers that are changed after every guest (thank god). Good: location, large rooms, great value for the money, a basic (not great) breakfast, free internet access in the room/plus free computer in the lobby, daily newspapers, helpful staff. Bad: no safe in the room (small safety deposit box in hotel office, no fridge, no view (a usual city factor, and windows that do not open so you never know what the weather actually is. Although there is some things that bug me (as indicated above), the good out weights the bad. Enjoy the afternoon cookies.

Reviews.Title: “"Hampton Majestic - It's my kind of hotel"”
Reviews.Author: JackMan_ValleyGirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10am after a 17hr overnight Amtrak journey from Washington DC and our room was ready for us which was fantastic, we were able to shower and start exploring immediately. All the staff took pride in the hotel so much so I think they regard it as their hotel. We even saw the manager and duty manager ensuring that bins were emptied and the lobby kept clean. We had the breakfast every morning and it was sufficient to start the day, it does get busy however you can take it to your room or there are grab and go bags provided. We had a room on the 14th floor so no street noise, clean spacious with 2 queen sized beds which are big enough for 2 adults. Free internet access in the room and the lobby was great because we were able to check on trip advisor of places to go and see and also eat. One place that has not been reviewed on here is The Chop House directly opposite where we had a fantastic meal even though expensive at $121 which seems to be the going rate for all decent restaurants in USA at present. We visited all the attractions Willis Tower (Sears Tower as was) and had photos on the 103rd floor amazing, The John Hancock Tower is at the other end of the city also with great views, we didn't queue for the observatory instead head for the Signature Lounge on the 96th floor where we were able to sit at a window seat and have a drink and a bite to eat, even though you pay more it's worth it. The CTA system is easy to use and you can buy an all day card at CVS Pharmacies and Walgreens to allow you to jump on and off all day. We also took a water taxi which was only $4 for 2 and we were able to see the sights instead of paying for a cruise. Navy Pier has plenty for adults and kids. We hired bikes for the day and found the Lakeshore path easy to follow. Plenty of shopping on Michigan Avenue and for overseas visitors don't forget to visit Bloomingdales and Macy's customer relations desk first to get a 10% off card, you'll need your passport as ID. Millennium Park also has events throughout the summer and make sure you visit The Bean.

Reviews.Title: “Four and a Half Stars (or circles!)”
Reviews.Author: bagg10
Reviews.Content: just had a great four night stay in chicago over the bank holiday weekend. easy trip on the cta blue line to monroe street and a three minute walk from there. check-in was quick and welcoming. good sized rooms with a good shower. unfortunately, i can't give full marks because breakfast is a bit chaotic. the lobby area is way too small for a hotel of it's size and struggles to cope with the numbers. we had to take our breakfast upstairs a couple of times and when you do get a seat, it isn't possible to relax because you know somebody will be wanting your seat. first time i've ever used plastic trays and knives and forks in a hotel too! also, although you get a 'hot' breakfast, the only constant was the scrambled eggs. bacon was available, it seemed, every other day. one day they had 'sausage sauce'!!?? anyway, all in all it was great value.

Reviews.Title: “Will Return”
Reviews.Author: kjoadd
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms - one for my husband and I, one for my brother - so that we could take in the Cardinals vs. the Cubs baseball games Memorial Day weekend, and will definitely return to this hotel again. Location, location, location! Convenient to both the blue and red subway lines, and taxis are plentiful in the neighborhood. All staff that I encountered were friendly and helpful, and the rooms were comfortable - I was pleasantly surprised that the rooms were as big as they were because it is an older building, and in older hotels the rooms are typically small. We stayed on the 14th floor, so street noise wasn't an issue. Updated decor.Free breakfast (biscuits & gravy, waffles, yogurt, fruit, bagels & muffins, juices, coffee, cereal, etc.) Very close to lots of shopping, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: VDJTraveler
Reviews.Content: Convenient to public transportation. Came into Union Station via Amtrak around 10 pm on a Friday and the walk to hotel was not too far and felt safe on the walk. King room on 21st floor on North side of building. Did not hear any city/street noise - very good night's rest - bed extremely comfortable. Not a lot of extra space in the room but it was more than adequate since we didn't spend much time in the room. BOA theatre right next door - couldn't get anymore convenient if you're going there to see a show. Breakfast was good - typical of any other Hampton Inn. Not a lot of seating though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NC-member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights to attend the SAIC graduation. Hotel was located within one block of the subway station (blue line) to airport. The first three floors of the building occupy the Bank of America theatre. You will enter through the the ground floor and take the elevator up to the 4th floor, the lobby. The hotel rooms are situated on floors above the 4th, I think they go the the 21st floor. The hotel is three blocks from Millenium Park and the Art Institute, both of which are extraordinary. Also immediately adjacent to State Street, a main shopping area, and accessible to subway and bus lines. The rooms are very nice. Recently renovated, comfortable bed, nice furnishings. We stayed in a king suite which included a king bed, microwave, mini fridge, coffee maker, fold out coach. Room size was fine, the high ceilings made it seem larger. Housekeeping service was perfect. Breakfast was good, eggs, meats, fruit, waffles, really everything we needed. The desk staff was terrific. The gentleman that checked us in was very personable and willing to help. We never bothered him except for directions to various Museums. As an aside, the subway to and from O'Hare was great. The CTA staff was very helpful (weird, but true). This a.m. the CTA attendant at the Monroe station even assisted us with our luggage. Trip to airport is around 45 minutes. Also, check out the Museum at the Art Institute. Free on Thursday evenings from 5-8.

Reviews.Title: “This place is terrific”
Reviews.Author: thereyougo
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inns are not usually our thing, but this place was great. We requested an early check-in after traveling all night, and they got us in our room 4 hours early. The room was goodly size and attractive. Everyone in the hotel was genuinely friendly and seemed to enjoy making our guest experience as good as possible. The location is also excellent, central to lots of the best things in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaydo_70
Reviews.Content: Many of my high school girlfriends and I (with my husband) met in Chicago to celebrate our 70th birthday year. We had a wonderful experience...the Hampton Majestic could not have been a better location for us...within walking distance to many of the sights we were interested in seeing. And the service people at the Hampton went above and beyond our expectations in helping us out with questions, were friendly and courteous. We will be going back there if we ever get back to Chicago....which we hope to do.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rgants
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms in the hotel! Roomy with high ceilings and also in the theater district. The staff was helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel far exceeded our expectations....friendly, helpful staff and quiet rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ssteinauer
Reviews.Content: Great location to shopping, restaurants and tourist sites,,,,plus easy access to subway stations. Would tay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a cool area of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cmartin66
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of Hampton Inns. This is one of the nicest. It isn't a motel, it is a true hotel in a historic building. There was tremendous character to the whole facility. And, the room and lobby came with all of the quality amenities that one would expect from a Hampton Inn. Best of all, the staff was EXTREMELY helpful and friendly. They run a great hotel. I would stay there again in a hearbeat. Craig Martin

Reviews.Title: “Great city, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: swim_coach61
Reviews.Content: It's unusual, but I really have nothing bad to say. Ok, I'm not keen on the single serve coffee makers, I kind of like having the whole 4 cups available, nor was I impressed by two sugars but only ONE creamer in the coffee condiment package -- but really.... I picked the hotel based on reviews, location, and the fact that they offered luggage storage. I arrived in Chicago at 10:00 am, with a check in of 3:00pm, While there was a possibility the hotel could get me in early, why take a chance on having to wander the cite WITH my luggage. I simply parked it at the hotel and started my sight-seeing. By the time I came back, the room was ready, my luggage was safe, and I was a happy camper. At the end of my trip, my train didn't leave until 6pm, I was able to leave my luggage with the porter and do more sight-seeing, again, WITHOUT the luggage. The room was spacious, as was the bathroom (I loath the tiny bathrooms!). A king bed, large chair, desk, wireless internet (FREE!), flat screen TV w/DVD. and so on. Ok, I had no real view, but I wasn't paying for one, either. Breakfast was pretty darn good. Ok, so I'm a "make your own waffle" fanatic -- and that's what I did, love it. There were also scrambled eggs available (unfortunately well OVER-cooked and rubbery balls both mornings), and bacon on Saturday, sausage gravy on Sunday (w/biscuits, of course). The food was hot and plentiful. There was also a selection of fruits, as well as the obligatory pastry/toasts selection. Coffee, tea, cocoa, and juices at the ready. Three blocks from Millennium Park, a couple of blocks from the Chicago River -- ideally situated. I'm a walker, I walked to Lake Michigan, Shedd Aquarium, Magnificent Mile, Museum of Contemporary Art (Northside), and so on. My feet were dying at the end of each day, but the distances were not the problem. I fell in love with Chicago over these 2.5 days (of course, it was MAY -- February might find my opinion slightly less positive), and intend to return. This hotel will be first on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, good value”
Reviews.Author: wkentf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hampton Inn Majestic 3 nights first weekend of May, 2010. Traveling with wife and 23 year old son. Great location. Within walking distance of anything within loop. Blue line and Red line stops only one block away. Easy to get a taxi or catch a bus. Queen beds were very comfortable, rooms very clean, not huge, but adequate. Employees were very friendly, always greeting with a smile and willing to chit chat. Breakfast was average for this class of hotel - cereals, make your own waffle, yogurt, fruit, juices, coffee, muffins, rolls. Everything was fresh. Rooms were pretty quiet considering downtown location, but could hear sirens, etc. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn always a good bet”
Reviews.Author: mfaghih
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hampton Inn Majestic while he was in Chicago for business. The location was good for him but I would have liked to be a little closer to the shopping. Only a few miles if you want to walk but I am 6 months pregnant so that made it a little difficult. The breakfast in the morning was fantastic. Lots to choose from and good quality food. The bed was more comfortable than most and the decor in the rooms was nice. The one thing that stands out about this hotel is the staff. They were great-always very courteous and helpful. The worst thing was probably the thin walls. Just hope you don't have a loud neighbor next to you. Overall it was a great hotel and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A classic hotel given the Hampton touch...”
Reviews.Author: travelingteacher87
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exceptional. It was obviously a historic building, but the hotel had been updated with all the modern amenities. The rooms were great! Very spacious, well equiped and super clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The breakfast buffet was very well maintained and the food was excellent. This was a great place to stay and enjoy the sites around the South Loop area...it was very convenient to lots of downtown locals. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty good”
Reviews.Author: SPman00
Reviews.Content: I was pretty impressed with this hotel - its a nice renovation of a very old property and probably a great value for the area. The breakfast area was small and could use some improvements and be sure to call down to get your car 15 minutes in advance

Reviews.Title: “hospitality was great”
Reviews.Author: diamolil
Reviews.Content: visited Hampton Inn Majestic for a personal business trip. The hotel is very well located within walking distance to just about everything, also took the hop on/ hop off tour. While wating for our airport shuttle, meet the manager, Lisa, what a very nice person, made us feel very comforable, since we had a few hours to wait. Gave us a little history of what to do next time we visit, and we will back to visit and will definately stay at this hotel. The room was very nice and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place--with an exceptional location & value for price paid”
Reviews.Author: slbpetvet
Reviews.Content: Our 3-night stay in Chicago was for theater, the Art Institute, and fine dining pleasure (but this hotel should also be great for business travelers, judging from the mix of hotel guests in the breakfast area). Our room was very nicely appointed in a clean, modern style-- actually identical to one shown on the website; super-comfortable king bed, nice couch & ottoman by the flat-screen TV, fridge & microwave/bar area very convenient. The shower & bathroom were equally nice, good size, great lighting & storage shelves, great shower, etc. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit-- only two relatively minor flaws: (1.) on one of our three-night stays, the housekeeper neglected to empty our ice bucket & replace the liner, and (2.) the breakfast, while free, was fairly typical/average for a chain hotel, with rubbery eggs & common, sugary pastries/breads. Neither of these issue was a big deal, and we would stay here again without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: BuzzMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I chose this Hotel because of the location and I have stayed in Hampton Inns before. The location is great with the train right at the door. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff friendly and helpful and breakfast is included.Also wireless internet worked well and the access code are provided at check-in no need contact reception again as is often the case elsewhere. And at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room + Great Location + Great Staff = Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dstang596
Reviews.Content: Am a frequent business traveler to Chicago and the Hampton Inn Majestic has become my hotel of choice for the reasons listed above. The rooms are modern and very comfortable; its is centrally located within the Loop; the staff could not be more friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “This was a fantastic hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: beccajpaul
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often and this was by far my best hotel experience. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, they serve a great breakfast every morning with eggs, bacon, cereals, muffins, fruit, yogurt, and even waffles. And did I mention it's included! Plus they have complementary coffee and tea and cookies all day long. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, good quality mattresses and nice sound proof walls. They also have free wi-fi which is a big plus. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Period.”
Reviews.Author: NJTripster
Reviews.Content: My review of the Hampton Inn will be a little dated, but it definitely deserves high praise. My girlfried and I stayed here in August 2008 for 8 nights. This was both our first time visiting Chicago. We couldn't have been happier with our selection. We picked this place based on the reviews on Tripadvisor.com. Thanks to all for their honest reviews! If you're looking for a place with a great location, this is it! It was very easy to navigate throughout the city from this loaction. Getting to the hotel from the airport was easy as well. One train stop will get you block or two away from the front door! Don't expect a grand entrance, because there is none. What you get in terms of value is the location, service, and room quality. We also enjoyed the continental breakfast every morning and the free wireless internet inside our room. If you don't have time to sit for breakfast, they offer free travel snack bags. Chicago in the middle of summer was quite hot, but our air conditioner was excellent. The bed was amazingly comfortable. We were well rested day in and day out. As for location, you can't beat it. It is so close to public transportation and is walkable to many major tourists sites. It is also very close to many great restaurants and shopping. Next time we go to Chicago, we will be staying here! Great job Majestic Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and cosy experience.”
Reviews.Author: Hubert_Cumberdale
Reviews.Content: A small group of us stayed here for the duration of 4 nights. The hotel is located within walking distance from public transport and almost everything in Chicago (if you like walking). The area it is located can appear desolate and quiet late at night, aside from the odd poor homeless cretin asking for loose change and the like. The rooms are spacious and cosy. Very good value compared to similar premises in the Chicago area. The front desk staff are informal and relaxed but efficient. Checking in and out was a breeze. Breakfast offers a wide range of hot and cold choices and is resupplied regularly. Will stay here again when I visit next. The fitness centre is small, with only a few machines; water and towels are provided and it is immaculately clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location.”
Reviews.Author: deannabond
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hampton Majestic. We arrived at the hotel around 9:45 a.m. and we actually checked in to our room. It was clean and ready for us. We got a room with a king bed, sofa and foot stool. It also had a mini frig and microwave. Nice to have for drinks and any food left overs after dinners out. We didn't have a view of th city, just an office building, but that was fine. Wandered down the street a block and ended up having breakfast at The Corner Bakery. It was yummy. Similar to a Panera type of restaurant. Although they bring your food to the table after you order. Hotel is near the Art Institute which was free to visit in Feb. Quite a bonus. We also walked to Millenium Park and to several stores close by to shop. Clean, well decorated and the staff we enountered were very helpful and friendly. Would recommend to anyone visiting Chicago who wants to stay in the loop.

Reviews.Title: “What a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Larus-glaucescens
Reviews.Content: The lobby is on the 4th floor and it is unpretentious, but don't let that discourage you. Once you start down the hall and go into your room, you will be glad you stayed here. This is a very nice hotel. It is clean, up-to-date, and well-decorated. It is nicer than, say, the average Holiday Inn Express, yet it was only $89 per night (in February) and it is on the Loop in the Theater District. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a nice view of the city. The fitness room is small but very nice. The machines are high quality. There are two treadmills, each with a TV screen (bring your own headphones). There is an elliptical strider, a bike, a weight machine, a water cooler, towels, and two floor mats. You can control the temperature with a thermostat on the wall. It was peaceful and quiet in there because there is no central TV. Our room was very nicely decorated--it seemed to be newly remodeled. The bathroom had new fixtures. Felt more like a nice Hilton. There is no restaurant in the hotel, but there is a free breakfast. The breakfast is similar to a Holiday Inn Express breakfast, but a little better with more variety. I do wish the omelets had been vegetarian (they contained ham) and I do wish they would use paper plates instead of Styrofoam. This hotel was a great find for us--an affordable but quality place to stay right downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay at the Hampton Inn Majestic Theater”
Reviews.Author: CAR50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a long weekend trip to Chicago. We arrived via Amtrak at Union Station. The Hampton Inn Majestic Theater was about a 15 minute walk from Union Station. The main attraction that we wanted to see was the Art Institute of Chicago. The Art Institute was about a 5 minute walk from the hotel. The Chicago Auto Show was also going on while we were there, so we caught a free shuttle to the auto show from one of the downtown parking garages which was about 10 minutes from the hotel. The location was perfect for what we wanted to do. The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The valet staff would open the door for you and help you with your bags onto the elevator. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms were quiet and beds were soft. There are only 9 rooms per floor, so it was almost like having a whole floor to yourself. The breakfast was good, with scrambled eggs, bacon, biscuits and gravy, waffles and assorted cereals, fruit and muffins. I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for someone who wants to get away from the hustle and bustle of some of the larger hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Markate
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break and thought the Hampton Inn Hotel was excellent, especially for the price (Â£70 per night). All the staff were very friendly. Rooms clean and comfortable with plenty of towels available. More than enough for breakfast. Juices, fresh fruit, eggs and sausage or bacon, toast, bagels, muffins and make your own waffles. We found we didnâ€™t need lunch most days. The hotel is in a very good location. Just around the corner from the blue line CTA station. It was $2.25 from the airport (40 minutes). We ate at the Italian Village (upstairs) and Millers Pub, both very close and had excellent meals in a good atmosphere. We also had a meal on Navy Pier at Charlies Ale House which was good, before seeing a play in the Shakespear Theatre. Get your half price tickets from the Visitor Centre. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “re this hotel has pro's and con's”
Reviews.Author: buckeyelulu
Reviews.Content: The pro's - location is very good for theatre/museum of art/the loop/metro/some shopping etc/downtown. Felt safe (room key needed to run elevator up to rooms). Business ctr (2 computers - sometimes one down). Rooms fine - no real complaints. Exercise room very small but good equipment/clean - two treadmills and one elliptical. no weights, no swimming pool. The con's - the staff at the front desk could be much friendlier - especially on weekends ((tonight - sunday evening - not so friendly). Not impressed with any of the staff at the front desk evenings/weekend. No cookies on weekends. I actually never saw cookies on weekedays either. Disappointing. I look forward to the cookies! The breakfast area is combined with the computers and tv - all in one big room. If you have a big student group or other group there, it can get very very noisy and busy. Its difficult to get away to study/read etc. There really is no space besides your room which is quiet. Get to breakfast when it opens if there is a big group in the hotel. There are not enough chairs/tables/space for everyone if you don't. Thats about it. Overall I'd stay here again and recommend. Location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelfromBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night since it was by the office. For that reason, it was a good location for me. You have Miller's pub and Italian Village nearby for restaurants. I like that is was near public transportation. It cost me about $40 from ORD to this hotel at night and on the way to the airport, i took the subway about a block or two away to the airport for $3 during rush hour. The room was decent/clean. Gym was simple with a treadmill and elliptical - I can see it being crowded in the mornings. There is a free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “This is THE hotel of choice for the business traveler in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Union_Rep
Reviews.Content: After having stayed in a number of downtown hotels and finding them all lacking in one aspect or another, the Hampton Inn Majestic is my new home away from home. The room was tastefully decorated, spacious, comfortable and clean; the complimentary breakfast buffet and in-room Internet were welcome amenities; and the staff was courteous, professional and helpful. The hotel is very secure and within easy walking distance to excellent shopping on State Street and some very fine eateries, including my personal favorite, the Berghoff. The hotel is the perfect destination for the business traveler, but I'm coming back with the family for a weekend in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, spotless room”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller091
Reviews.Content: I have a food allergy, and the front desk staff was completely accommodating. The service was great. The hotel is near the Art Institute and lots of public transportation. Most importantly, the price was right, the room was spotless, temperature control was terrific, and the bed was clean and comfortable. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: robbhaney
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with a great location. Walking distance to everything. Very helpful staff. Would stay again and again!

Reviews.Title: “This is a terrific hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NanaCathy
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the recent reviews for this hotel, I booked a king-bed room for this past weekend. Thank you for posting your reviews; I would not have taken a chance on this hotel if it hadn't been for all the positive feedback. And the reviewers were absolutely correct - the Hampton Inn Majestic Chicago is great, and I'd certainly recommend it to other travelers. Very quiet hallways, efficient, well-decorated room and nice little buffet in the lobby - perfect for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! You really can't go wrong!!! Best deal in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: saracusp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I poured over hundreds of reviews of so many hotels, and were really nervous because even the most expensive hotels had some horrible reviews but this place's 'bad reviews' didn't seem that bad so we booked a 9 night stay here for a little get away, which we DO NOT REGRET! AWESOME HOTEL! First, the customer service is outstanding. Super friendly and accommodating. Our luggage was lost, and they made sure it was delivered to our room timely when it arrived. Every time we shared an elevator with an employee, they were sooo nice, and the cleaning staff were friendly too! Second, the rooms are lovely and VERY CLEAN. The rooms are super spacious for a city hotel, in fact we were surprised by it. Third, there is a free continental breakfast which is a lot nicer than most of the ones I've seen in my day. Fourth, perfect location. Safe, quiet but access to everything. Some people in the reviews were moaning and groaning b/c the community areas are small and the decor has dark colors and the rooms don't have enough lights. What a bunch of babies - who wants to hang out in the community areas? Get out in the city or relax in your home. Yes, the breakfast area gets crowded but that is small price to pay. As for the decor, our room was brown and orange, personally I loved the colors. It was NOT gothic as others said. It had a nice, clean look to it overall. PLENTY of lamps to light up the whole room. Are you performing surgery in your room? No? Then I think the light provided will suffice! If I had to complain about anything it would be the price of the valet service - $42 per night at the time of this review BUT you get free in/out privileges, which none of the other garages allowed which we liked b/c it was soooo cold this time of year. So it worked for us but if you are only taking the car out 1 x per day there are garages up the street for about $15 less per night. We would definitely go back in a heart beat. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Noteworthy biz class hotel with great service in the Loop!”
Reviews.Author: Rigi34
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here for a sports weekend with my dad (Go BEARS!). The hotel is in the Loop in the theater district south of the river. It's a stones throw from Michigan Ave, around 4 blocks from the Institute of Art and about 2 blocks from the Marshall Fields flagship. The Adams/Wabash metro station is 1.5 blocks away ($2.25 fare from Midway takes about 20-25 min). The hotel has been recently renovated and was very clean. Lobby is small but offers a business center with two internet PC's and printer free of charge for hotel guests.
